title: Should We Talk More About ‘Following Jesus’?
description: In the Gospels, Jesus repeatedly tells people to follow him. But why doesn’t that call ring out in the rest of the New Testament?

title: Is Christmas Too Pagan for Christians?
description: Christmas offers an opportunity to look upon the incarnation with fresh amazement. But does the timing of our celebration just reflect pagan tradition?

title: Why Did Christ Need a Body?
description: In the person of Jesus Christ, we encounter incarnate Deity. But why did he have to take on flesh that first Christmas?

title: Do We Have the Exact Words of Christ, or a Paraphrase?
description: Do the Gospels give us the exact words that Jesus spoke, or do they give us a paraphrase that captures his meaning?

title: Does Joy Come After Suffering, Or in It?
description: Faith does not shield us from waves of sorrow. But it does plant our feet on a rock of immovable joy. And when the waves leave, the rock remains.

title: The Sweetness of Christ in 2020
description: As 2020 draws to a close, Pastor John describes the one reality that shaped everything else for him: the experience of sweeter fellowship with God.

title: What Happens to Non-Christians Who Take the Lord’s Supper?
description: What happens when unbelievers eat the Lord’s Supper — either because they think they are believers or because the church has welcomed them to participate?

title: Christian Marries Non-Christian — How Does a Church Respond?
description: How should pastors respond to a Christian who marries a non-Christian? And what might repentance look like in such a situation?

title: Fight Sin Like a Victor, Not a Victim
description: When Christ gives you new life by the Spirit, you are no longer a victim under sin’s power, but a victor who has the strength to triumph.

title: How Do I Battle Imposter Syndrome?
description: Imposter syndrome can make us feel like frauds in the workplace — like we are never good enough and always about to be exposed. How can we respond?

title: Did Jesus Say We Are gods?
description: In John 10, Jesus quotes from Psalm 82, saying, “You are gods.” Does this mean human beings are gods, or is something else going on?

title: What’s Keeping Me from Seeing Jesus?
description: By nature, we all want to be made much of. Until that craving for praise is laid to rest, we’ll never know the joy of making much of Jesus.

title: Can I ‘Name It and Claim It’?
description: God can do far, far more than we can think to ask. But that doesn’t mean whatever we wish lines up with his sovereign plans to bring us good.

title: Ten Effects of Seeing and Savoring the Providence of God
description: When we see and savor the all-embracing, all-pervasive providence of God, we cannot help but show the worth of his providence in all of life.

title: Have You Seen the Providence of God?
description: Immersing ourselves in the ocean of God’s providence helps us to know him, fear him, trust him, and love him as we ought.

title: God’s Providence in 2020
description: In January 2021, John Piper releases his newest book: a 750-page study of the all-embracing, all-pervasive providence of God.

title: Does God Regret Making Me?
description: We know that God is committed to saving his people. But does he ever become so frustrated with us that he regrets having made us in the first place?

title: What Makes Us Want to Move and Travel?
description: Our cravings can take us to new spouses, new jobs, or even new cities or countries. But there is only one place we’ll find the satisfaction we seek.

title: My Wife Is More Spiritual — How Do I Lead Her?
description: As a husband, I know that God calls me to lead my family. But what if my wife is more capable and more spiritually mature than I am?

title: Am I Completely Surrendered to Christ?
description: Jesus calls us to renounce all we have to follow him. But how can we gauge if we are fully and completely committed to him?

title: How Can I Grow in Obeying God?
description: Unless God enables our obedience, we work and serve in vain. All true obedience flows from the strength he supplies.

title: I Sought a Prostitute — Am I Doomed?
description: Proverbs says that no one who visits the “forbidden woman” will return to the paths of life. So, is a man who seeks a prostitute doomed?

title: When Does God Harden a Sinner’s Heart?
description: Does God harden sinners’ hearts only in response to their persistent sin, or is their sin a result of his prior hardening?

title: God’s Good Design in Our Suffering
description: In this life, we will have trouble. But every trial paves the way to an inheritance with Christ that will satisfy us forever.

title: Do My Past Sins Work Toward My Future Good?
description: We know that God works all things together for the good of his people. But does “all things” include even our sins?

title: How Do We Raise Kids Who Are Not Naive or Cynical?
description: As Christians, we aspire to live out the paradox of brokenhearted boldness. But how do we teach and model this attitude for our kids?

title: How Did God Call Me to Himself?
description: From our perspective, coming to Jesus Christ feels like placing our faith in him. But God himself enabled and awakened that faith in us.

title: I’m Obsessed with My Appearance — How Can I Stop?
description: We know outward beauty is insignificant compared to inward beauty. But what should we do if we still feel insecure about our looks?

title: Are Our Standards for Sexual Purity Too High for Pastors?
description: Is faultless chastity an appropriate standard for pastors, or are our expectations simply too high?

title: My Suffering Feels Meaningless — What Can I Do?
description: Sometimes pain seems meaningless, but in Christ, every millisecond of your suffering is producing for you an eternal weight of glory.

title: How Can I Love God More Than My Boyfriend?
description: As a couple’s affection for one another deepens, how can they make sure they are loving God more than each other?

title: Is My Suffering a Correction for Sin?
description: When trials come, how can I know whether God is calling me to patiently endure, or whether he wants me to repent of a specific sin?

title: How Do We Get Tricked into Sinning?
description: When we obey sin, we obey a liar, a deceiver, a murderer. Sin is a slave master who tricks his subjects into eternal death.

title: Why Did Demons Ask Jesus for Pigs?
description: When Jesus comes, he brings deliverance, freedom, grace, and power. But some people prefer what life is like without him.

title: Why Do I Need to Read the Bible When We Have Bible Teachers Online?
description: Today more than ever, Christians have access to a wealth of faithful Bible teaching online. So, why do we need to read the Bible for ourselves?

title: Dismiss the Devil with a Song
description: Singing together is not merely the prelude to the sermon. When God’s people sing from the heart, more happens than we imagine.

title: Is Enjoying God the Same as Glorifying God?
description: “God is most glorified in us when we are most satisfied in him.” Does that mean enjoying God and glorifying God are the same thing?

title: Why Is the Bible So Violent?
description: The Bible depicts more violence than our modern sensibilities often want to admit. How do we handle these parts of Scripture when we come across them?

title: How Do I Overcome My Fear of the Future?
description: In this life, we will have trouble. In this world, we will have reasons to fear. But in Christ, our God is with us through it all.

title: Why Does It Matter That Christ Was ‘Begotten, Not Made’?
description: The Nicene Creed speaks of Jesus as “begotten, not made.” What does that mean, and why does it matter?

title: Money Motivates Me to Work Hard — Is That Okay?
description: How can we tell if our desire for money is a good, God-given desire, instead of a love for Mammon? Pastor John offers seven ways to discern the difference.

title: How Do I Tell If I Am Lukewarm?
description: How can we tell if we are spiritually lukewarm, like the Christians in Laodicea? We can look at our private prayer life.

title: What Do You Love Most About God?
description: Unless the Bible informs what we love most about God, we risk imagining a god in our own likeness, rather than treasuring him for who he really is.

title: ‘Always Learning but Never Arriving’ — Is That Me?
description: Paul warns us about some who are “always learning and never able to arrive at a knowledge of the truth.” What kind of person does he have in mind?

title: What Is God Accomplishing in My Suffering?
description: Suffering often feels meaningless in the moment. So how can Christians learn not only to endure trials, but to rejoice in the midst of them?

title: What Do My Entertainment Habits Reveal About My Soul?
description: If we cope with stress by watching movies, posting on social media, or consuming other forms of entertainment, what does that say about our souls?

title: Does Every Sin Cost Me an Eternal Reward?
description: God promises eternal rewards for his people’s present obedience. But does every sin cost us one of those rewards?

title: I Feel Unappreciated — How Should I Respond?
description: Ingratitude can make us feel unwanted and unnoticed. But our Father in heaven sees in secret, and he will more than make up for every thankless deed.

title: Is My Career in Marketing Vain?
description: Some marketing succeeds by cultivating consumerism in the human heart. Can a Christian glorify God in that kind of job?

title: How Do I Recover from an Unbearable Tragedy?
description: Some tragedies make life feel barely worth living anymore. So is there any hope that we could one day be happy and at peace again?

title: What Does My Stealing Say About My Soul?
description: Whether we steal time, money, glances, or anything else, our impulse to take what is not rightfully ours reveals a lot about our view of God.

title: Will the New Creation Look Like This One?
description: The new creation will probably seem familiar to us. But there will also be new dimensions of life and joy we can’t even begin to fathom.

title: Is Angry Prayer Okay?
description: We have nothing to hide from God since he already knows our hearts. But that doesn’t mean we can do or say whatever we want in prayer.

title: How Did John Piper Become a Calvinist?
description: When John Piper entered seminary in 1968, he believed in the self-determining will of man. But then he encountered Philippians 2 and Romans 9.

title: When Should I Follow My Heart?
description: If a Christian desires God above all, then shouldn’t he follow his heart? Or are our hearts so deceitful that we can never trust them at all?

title: Ten Reasons to Read the Bible Every Day
description: If we are going to grow up into maturity in Christ, we need to feast on Scripture — and not just here and there, but every day.

title: How Does Christ Change How I Work?
description: When you come to know Jesus Christ, something about everything in your life changes — including how you approach your vocation.

title: How Do I Lead Someone to Christ?
description: To lead someone to Christ is a spectacular gift from God. But what should you actually say and do in the moment?

title: Do We Need Extrabiblical Texts to Understand the Bible?
description: Extrabiblical sources can help fill in some details of our Bible study, but all the gold we need to mine for life and godliness is in our English Bibles.

title: Did God Save Me to Call Attention to Himself?
description: Over and over in the Bible, God says that he saves us in order to draw attention to himself. Why did God design salvation that way?

title: Are Christian Couples Required to Have Kids?
description: The Bible is clear that children are a gift from God. So is there any room for a Christian couple to decide not to have any?

title: Can a Christian Hedonist Get Depressed?
description: If we glorify God by enjoying him, how do we think about seasons of darkness in the Christian life, when joy seems far away?

title: How Do I Wait for God?
description: God works for those who wait for him. But what does it mean to wait for God?

title: How Do I Glorify God in My Daily Life?
description: God created us to glorify him by enjoying him forever. But how do we fulfill that purpose in the little things, in the small moments, in the day to day?

title: Am I Wasting My Life in a Secular Job?
description: Our vocation doesn’t automatically determine our fruitfulness for Jesus. God uses all kinds of people in all kinds of places to accomplish his purposes.

title: How Does God Become Totally for Me?
description: God won’t settle for anything less than perfection from us. Either we depend on Christ’s perfection in our place, or we keep the entire law.

title: How Do I Wage War on My Self-Pity?
description: At the cross, Christ canceled all our sins through his blood. Now, by the Spirit, we work to conquer every canceled sin.

title: Seven Lessons for Productivity
description: After fifteen hundred episodes of the Ask Pastor John podcast, Pastor John shares seven lessons that have inspired him to labor faithfully over decades.

title: What Does Freedom from the Love of Money Look Like?
description: Our hearts were never meant to find their meaning in money. God made us for something far more valuable.

title: How Can I Disagree with My Husband and Still Submit?
description: How can a wife disagree with her husband about a decision while still submitting to his leadership in the home?

title: How Do I Know If I’m Doing Enough for God?
description: Before you get overwhelmed by all of the Bible’s commands, remember your right standing with God and focus first on the anchors of faithful obedience.

title: Why Do I Need to Be Saved?
description: At the cross, God not only clears a path for sinners to himself. He also vindicates his righteousness after passing over centuries of sin.

title: Why Does ‘Atonement’ Disappear in the New Testament?
description: The word “atonement” appears all over the ESV’s translation of the Old Testament, but never in the New. Didn’t Jesus make atonement for our sins?

title: How Much Patriotism Is Too Much Patriotism?
description: If Christians are first and foremost citizens of heaven, then is it ever appropriate to show patriotism for a homeland?

title: How Can I Be Free from Materialism?
description: For many Western Christians, materialism has transformed our wants into needs and distorted our view of biblical Christianity. How can we be free?

title: Did Moses Think Sinners Could Keep the Law?
description: The Mosaic law requires obedience over and over again. Does that mean old-covenant believers earned their way to a right standing with God?

title: Do I Need to Understand the Trinity to Be Saved?
description: What does someone need to know about the Trinity in order to have saving faith in Jesus?

title: How Do I Find Freedom from Worry?
description: In the moment when troubles come or worries rise, we need the precious truth of specific promises from God’s word.

title: Would God Have Been More Loving Not to Create Anyone?
description: If God knew before he created the world that millions of people would suffer eternally in hell, would he have been more loving not to create at all?

title: Which Characters in Job Can We Trust?
description: Job is a famously difficult book to understand and apply. But God has not left us without interpretive guides to help us discern the book’s message.

title: What Do You See When You Look at the Sky?
description: All creation rings with its Maker’s praise. If we pause to look and listen, God can show us glory in all that he has made.

title: Why Does Christ Want Some Not to Believe?
description: If God desires all people to be saved, why did Jesus sometimes speak in a way that kept people from believing?

title: How Should Christians Respond to Climate Change?
description: Climate-change activists warn of dire consequences if nations and individuals refuse to care for the environment. How should Christians respond?

title: Why Must Our Bodies Get Resurrected?
description: Our resurrection bodies will allow us not only to experience life without disease and decay, but also to enjoy God in the bliss he intended.

title: Does the Law Aggravate Our Sin Nature?
description: The Mosaic law raises countless questions for Christians. But how might we begin to understand the function of the law in redemptive history?

title: What Are the Keys of the Kingdom of Heaven?
description: Jesus gave his disciples the keys to the kingdom of heaven so that they could loose and bind. What does that mean for Christians today?

title: What Do You Say to Evangelicals Who Affirm So-Called ‘Same-Sex Marriage’?
description: When someone close to you affirms so-called “same-sex marriage,” how do you respond in both faithfulness to Scripture and love for that person?

title: My Pastors Don’t Preach Against Sin — Is That Okay?
description: Addressing sin and repentance may sound harsh to some, but genuine biblical preaching names and denounces specific sins.

title: Does John Piper Deny Personal Assurance?
description: God gives believers warnings not to strip us of our assurance, but to keep us clinging to Christ and killing sin by the Spirit.

title: What Are God’s Purposes in a Recession?
description: God has thousands of purposes in all that he does — including recessions. What does Scripture tell us about God’s designs in our financial uncertainty?

title: How Much Joy Did the Curse Cost Me?
description: Because of the fall, we are by nature dead to joy in God. Because of the cross, we can experience more joy in God than we ever could have had in Eden.

title: Do My Sins Ruin God’s Plan for My Life?
description: Some sins unalterably change the course of our lives, leaving us to live with the consequences. Do these sins sabotage God’s best plan for us?

title: The God over Viruses
description: If we say God is sovereign, does that mean he’s in charge of everything — even down to the tiniest molecule?

title: Does Christ Govern Every Storm?
description: Jesus stilled a storm for his disciples two thousand years ago, but does that necessarily mean he controls every single storm today?

title: Am I Living by Faith or Unbelief?
description: The Bible calls us to walk by faith, but how can we actually know if we are living by faith instead of unbelief?

title: Could a Recession Serve Our Joy?
description: Sometimes it takes a recession to dig up the roots of our lives and replant them in soil that causes us to bear the fruit of generosity.

title: What Is Hyper-Calvinism?
description: Doctrinal systems can help us summarize the Bible’s teaching, but they are never a substitute for Scripture itself.

title: What Is Grace?
description: We often define “grace” as “undeserved favor.” But the grace of God has another meaning in the Bible that is filled with encouragement and comfort.

title: How Can I Receive Christ?
description: The help Jesus offers isn’t a commodity you can buy with money or morality. To have the Son, you must receive him by faith.

title: Is the Calvinist-Arminian Debate Really Important?
description: Are Calvinism and Arminianism just points of debate for theologians, or do they actually have real-life implications on our relationship with God?

title: How Should We Dress for Church?
description: How we dress for church will depend on our vision of God, our understanding of God’s people, and our grasp of what is at stake when we gather.

title: What Are the Spiritual Dangers of Technology?
description: Technology can make our lives easier and more efficient than ever. But it can also slowly numb our affections to the things that matter most.

title: Is the Christian’s Heart Deceitfully Wicked?
description: Is the Christian heart still wicked and deceitful? Or does God give us a completely new heart at the new birth?

title: What Sins Disqualify a Pastor for Life?
description: Should churches ever consider calling a pastor who has committed adultery in the past? And if so, how should they evaluate his repentance?

title: Sovereign Comfort for Uncertain Times
description: When crisis hits, Jesus Christ remains on his throne. He reigns supreme, and he will never leave nor forsake his people.

title: Why Do We Confess If Our Sins Are Already Forgiven?
description: If Christians are already fully forgiven, justified, and united with Christ, then why do we need to continually confess our sins to God?

title: Is God Humble?
description: As we seek to put away pride and become more humble, is there any humility in God for us to imitate? Or is humility fitting only for creatures?

title: More Precious Than Praise and Possessions
description: How we handle our possessions in this world and the praise of man not only shapes our lives now, but determines our fate for eternity.

title: I’m Afraid of Surrendering to Christ — What Can I Do?
description: The life Jesus promises when you follow him far surpasses anything you might have to give up. There is no greater joy than in walking with him.

title: Why Do We Celebrate Easter?
description: If Jesus remained in the grave, then his followers have no hope. But Jesus didn’t stay dead. Christ is risen.

title: Why the Sovereignty of God Is Good News
description: The doctrine of God’s sovereignty does not sit on the periphery of theology. Without the sovereignty of God, we have no gospel.

title: How Do I Know If the Holy Spirit Is in Me?
description: Whether you became a Christian at age 5 or 85, God worked in you, by his Holy Spirit, to open your eyes to the wonder and beauty of Jesus Christ.

title: Is It a Sin to Back Out of a Commitment?
description: Honesty, integrity, and reliability should characterize every Christian. Since God delights in truth, so should his people.

title: Plan for Something Greater Than Retirement
description: Retirement is not the last chapter of life — eternity is the last chapter. And the hope of being with Jesus forever should shape our final years on earth.

title: Public, Private, Online, Homeschool?
description: When Christian parents have a number of educational options for their children, what biblical principles help us decide what’s best?

title: What’s Next for an Aging Pastor?
description: God never wastes his children. If you devote yourself to serving the Lord, he will never leave you without significant opportunities for good works.

title: Grace for Our Hardest Moments
description: Jesus may not give us everything we want, or even everything we think we need. But he will give us everything we truly need — all the way to the end.

title: Are IVF Babies Knit Together by God Too?
description: No technology can ever thwart God’s sovereignty. His oversight extends even to those advancements that seem to take his place.

title: A Word to Men Who Demean Their Wives
description: God calls husbands to provide and protect, not demean and belittle. Husbands must lead, but always with gentleness and grace, especially in the home.

title: Jesus Didn’t Die for Our Present Prosperity
description: Jesus doesn’t want disciples who seek him merely for what he can provide. He wants disciples who treasure him for who he is.

title: Jesus Came to Bring Violence — but What Does That Mean for Us?
description: Jesus told his disciples, “I have not come to bring peace, but a sword.” What kind of sword does the Prince of Peace bring?

title: How Do I Take Risks Without Being Unwise?
description: Jesus calls us away from self-protection and toward taking risks of love. To follow a sacrificial Savior is to give and sacrifice with him.

title: John Piper’s Death-Row Plea
description: Jesus does not discriminate. He offers the bread of life to anyone who calls on his name — even to those who have committed unspeakable crimes.

title: Am I Mainly the Product of My Background?
description: Are we free to be who we want to be, or are we instead the products of our backgrounds and environments?

title: If God Is Sovereign, Are My Prayers Pointless?
description: If all of God’s plans stand, and all of his purposes come to pass, is praying for what we want pointless?

title: Will Suffering Weaken My Ministry?
description: Suffering is not a hindrance to the spread of the gospel. Suffering is, very often, God’s means of spreading the gospel where it has never gone before.

title: How Do I Care for My Depressed Wife?
description: How can a husband cultivate an atmosphere of holy joy at home if his wife struggles with chronic sadness or depression?

title: How Can Couples Heal After Adultery?
description: After adultery, couples may feel like their marriage is ruined beyond repair. What biblical realities can help them begin to find healing?

title: How Can I Jumpstart My Prayer Life?
description: Prayer offers us a lifeline to our Lord, a vital connection we need every day. But unless we plan ahead, we will be prone to wander.

title: How Much Victory Can I Expect over Sinful Desires?
description: The new birth brings an awakening of delight in Christ and increasing victory over sin. But how much delight and victory should Christians expect?

title: How Do I Bless My Children Before Bed?
description: If you want to raise your children to know and love Jesus, then a regular rhythm of blessing may prove to be a helpful habit of grace.

title: Why Is My Theology Not Changing My Life?
description: If I believe all the right things, then why does my growth in holiness seem so tedious and slow?

title: Should Christians Attend Alcoholics Anonymous?
description: Alcoholics Anonymous, and programs like it, seem to genuinely help hurting people. But what do such programs miss that Christians can’t overlook?

title: Can We Love Both God and Pleasure?
description: If the Bible says that loving pleasure is a sign of ungodliness, then can we really make joy and pleasure essential to our pursuit of God?

title: How Do I Let Go of Anger over Past Wrongs?
description: How do we lay down our anger, our bitterness, our grudges against those who have wronged us and gotten away with it?

title: Would God Be Just as Glorified If We Were His Slaves?
description: God gets maximum glory from his people, not when we work for him out of begrudging duty, but when we run to him out of sheer delight.

title: How Do I Find a Good Church?
description: If you live near a number of gospel-preaching churches, how do you decide which body is best for you to join? Pastor John suggests nine steps.

title: How Do I Grow in Wisdom?
description: How do I become a sage who overflows with godly wisdom? Pastor John recommends a path too few of us choose to tread.

title: Should My Husband Pray with Me More?
description: We all need private, regular communion with God. But the Bible presents a vision for prayer that reaches well beyond our personal quiet times.

title: Should We Call Female Leaders ‘Pastors’?
description: The New Testament doesn’t apply the term “pastor” to any leader in the church, but only to qualified men who oversee and teach the flock.

title: Who Is Yahweh?
description: The God of our Bibles is more glorious than we can even begin to imagine. And it all begins with this fact: God absolutely and simply is.

title: Is John Piper Popular Because He Makes Christianity Look Intelligent?
description: What happens when a preacher saturates himself with the Scriptures, walks into a pulpit, and overflows with a God-entranced vision of all things?

title: Did My Dad Die Because I Lacked Faith?
description: James tells us that we have not because we ask not. But do we still lack sometimes because we don’t ask with enough faith?

title: Is Something Evil Only If It Harms Others?
description: Evil goes beyond the harm we commit against other humans. Evil is preferring anything above God, even if we harm no one in the process.

title: What Is the State of Race Relations in the Church?
description: Our perceptions of race relations in the church are of some importance. God’s vision for where race relations are heading is of infinite importance.

title: Is a Similar Sense of Calling Required for Marriage?
description: Most fundamentally, marriage is not a convenient matchup of vocations, but a covenant that displays the love Jesus has for his church.

title: How Should I Parent My Non-Christian Teen?
description: Should parents require non-Christian teens to attend church with them? And if so, how do they avoid creating hypocrites of their kids?

title: Are Hell and the Cross Overkill for Sin?
description: The cross will seem like an overreaction as long as man is big and God is small. The essence of sin is not harm done to man, but indignities done to God.

title: How Do We Respond to Claims That Christianity Is Dangerous?
description: How should Christians live in a culture that increasingly views our faith as bigoted, immoral, and even dangerous?

title: What Every Marriage Needs Most
description: What our marriages need most is probably not new and novel counsel from the latest book or seminar, but this one piece of timeless, biblical truth.

title: How Do I Respond to Sexual Dreams?
description: What do sexually illicit dreams reveal about our souls? Pastor John offers biblical principles for understanding dreams and practical ways to overcome them.

title: What Should I Expect My First Time Through the Bible?
description: What can you expect when you set out on a journey through the entire Bible? Pastor John offers three cautions and nine life-transforming hopes for every Bible reader.

title: Are Personal Resolutions Effective or Futile?
description: Are New Year’s resolutions helpful, are they harmful, or are they just a setup for eventual failure?

title: I Have a New Journaling Bible — How Should I Mark It Up?
description: Journaling Bibles can be a great way to go deeper in God’s word, but many feel paralyzed, not knowing what to write (or not).

title: How Concerned Should Christians Be with Consumerism?
description: In our good concern for what and how we consume, how do Christians keep from being consumed by ethical consumerism?

title: Why Was Christ Born into This World?
description: The wonder and glory of Christmas will never dry up because the manger lets loose waterfalls of mercy that will flow forever.

title: Should I Use Christmas Dinner for Evangelism?
description: As we gather around the dinner table this Christmas, how might we share the gospel with family who don’t understand the meaning of Jesus’s birth?

title: Does the Bible Forbid My Nativity Set?
description: The second commandment forbids using an image or likeness of God in worship. Does that mean we should take down our nativity sets?

title: How Do I Banish Low Thoughts of Christ?
description: The Christ who took on flesh and dwelt among us never had a beginning. He existed eternally before, and will be forever after.

title: How Do I Battle Subtle Temptations to Lust?
description: Victory over pornography use is no small thing, but that doesn’t mean our battle is over. God lays claim to every impulse in our hearts, however small.

title: Will All Nations Be Reached Before Christ Returns?
description: Did the biblical writers expect Jesus to return at any moment, or were they waiting for certain events to take place before the end would come?

title: What’s the Deepest Desire of My Heart?
description: The greatest ache of the human heart is not to have wealth, comfort, or power, but to see and savor the glory of God in the face of Christ.

title: I’m Not Good at My Job — Is the Lord Telling Me to Quit?
description: If we don’t see much success in a career we thought God called us to, did we misread his call?

title: How Can I Revitalize My Church from the Pulpit?
description: Whether a church is healthy or needs revitalization, every local congregation needs a consistent window to the greatness and glory of God from the pulpit.

title: What Happens When We Sing Together
description: Singing together is never just a formality in a church service. God uses truth in song to sustain, encourage, and recharge his people.

title: Why Do I Still Struggle with My Pre-Conversion Sins?
description: Every believer is already new in Christ, and yet vestiges of our old selves remain. We must fight every day to become who we already are.

title: My Life Is Endless Drudgery — How Do I Find Joy in Christ?
description: The burdens and drudgery of life may feel like walls keeping you from joy. But inside these walls, God Almighty is working for your everlasting good.

title: How Do We Feast to the Glory of God?
description: If God made everything good, then do we honor him just by using what he has made? Pastor John explains the essential steps to God-honoring feasting.

title: How Should I Handle My Regrets?
description: Every single one of us can look over our lives and find failures we regret. How do we deal with remorse in light of God’s mercy?

title: Is It Sinful to Watch Sin on a Screen?
description: Our culture saturates itself with entertainment that hardly gives a passing thought to God. Should Christians consume such media?

title: Is the God-Centeredness of God Precious?
description: When you discover that God is not only perfectly glorious, but that everything he does is for his glory, your life may get flipped upside down.

title: How Do I Stay Attracted to My Aging Spouse?
description: Sexual desire doesn’t begin and end with physical attraction. God made us to cherish inner beauty and glory, not just looks that pass with age.

title: Will We Pray in Heaven?
description: If heaven is a world of love, with no grief or pain or loss, then will we have any need to pray to God once we are there?

title: The Key to Our Victory over Sin
description: Only the grace of supernatural delight can empower us to resist the allure of sin’s constant temptations.

title: I Feel No Sexual Attraction — Should I Still Pursue Marriage?
description: If someone’s sexual desires are low to the point of indifference, should he or she still be open to marriage down the road?

title: Why Does the Bible Stress the Power of Jesus’s Name?
description: The Bible stresses repeatedly the power and greatness of Jesus’s name. But why does it emphasize his name, and not just his person?

title: ‘I Don’t Believe in Christ — Why Is Faith So Hard?’
description: If Jesus promises that his yoke is easy and his burden light, then why do some people struggle so much to put their faith in him?

title: When Has My Career Become My Idol?
description: If God created us for good works and wants us to labor diligently, then how do we determine when our career has become an idol?

title: Advice for Christians Who Work Sundays
description: If your job requires you to work on Sundays, how do you honor the Lord’s Day? Pastor John offers three pieces of counsel.

title: What Did the Reformation Give Us?
description: Every Protestant owes a debt of gratitude to the Reformers, especially for one of their most precious gifts to us: expository exultation.

title: Should We Stop Reading Dead White Guys?
description: Christians should judge a book not by the color of its author or the number of its century, but by the God-exalting or God-ignoring content of its pages.

title: Should Anyone Say, ‘I Am of Calvin’?
description: As we sit under preaching in our churches, what matters most is not how eloquent the teacher is, but how much truth shines forth in his content.

title: What Makes a Sermon Good?
description: Sermons are more than a transfer of facts and stories. They are a part of worship that God uses to work miracles in both the preacher and the people.

title: Should Stay-at-Home Moms Take a Day Off?
description: With all the demands on our time, how can young families pace themselves to run the marathon of life without burning out halfway through?

title: Are God’s Providence and God’s Sovereignty the Same?
description: God’s sovereignty is his right and power to do whatever he pleases. God’s providence is his wise and purposeful sovereignty.

title: When to Stop Listening to This Podcast
description: If God has given you elders in your local church and brothers and sisters in Christ, then why should you bother seeking wisdom from this podcast?

title: How Do I Follow God’s Will in the Face of Two Good Options?
description: God may not reveal every detail we want to know about our future, but he does promise to walk with us and direct our steps.

title: What Does the Bible Say About ‘National Coming Out Day’?
description: Our culture may celebrate sin and stifle truth, but that doesn’t mean we should lose hope. God can still grant an awakening.

title: How Do We Respond When a Pastor Leaves the Faith?
description: If we believe in the sovereignty of God, then how do we explain friends or prominent leaders who turn their backs on Jesus?

title: How Much ‘Lover’ Language Should We Use in Worship Songs?
description: Our song choices influence our churches nearly as much as our sermons. If we don’t choose our music with care, we aren’t shepherding well.

title: Should We Call Out False Teachers or Ignore Them?
description: False teachers threaten churches all over the world. Every Christian, and especially pastors, should know how to respond to their danger.

title: How Do I Submit to My Unbelieving Husband?
description: A wife’s submission to her husband is qualified submission. She follows Jesus first, and then does whatever she can to honor her husband’s leadership.

title: Is Everyone Punished the Same in Hell?
description: The Bible describes degrees of happiness for the saints in heaven. Does that mean there are degrees of despair in hell?

title: John Piper’s Most Bizarre Moment in Preaching
description: If John Piper wants Christians to find their ultimate happiness and joy in God, why hasn’t he ever told a joke from the pulpit?

title: Who Is John Piper?
description: We make plans and prepare for what’s ahead, but only God orders our steps. Pastor John shares his path toward a lifetime of fruitful ministry.

title: Is Baptism Necessary for Salvation?
description: The Bible commands us to be baptized, but what does the water actually do? Does it save us, like 1 Peter 3:21 appears to say?

title: We’re Back! — Update from John Piper
description: Pastor John recently finished a book on the providence of God — the purposeful sovereignty of a heavenly Father who loves and cares for his children.

title: How Do I Live Like a Son Rather Than a Slave?
description: God has called us sons and daughters, but his people sometimes talk as if we were still slaves. What does it mean to talk like children of God?

title: How Does ‘Christ Live in Me’ (Galatians 2:20)?
description: When we are saved, we’re united to Christ by the Spirit. Our old self — our unbelieving, rebellious, sin-loving self — dies, and we live by the Spirit.

title: Does Jesus Teach Us to Sell All Our Possessions?
description: Jesus said, “Sell your possessions, and give to the needy.” Are we disobeying Jesus if we don’t literally give away all that we have?

title: How Can I Forgive My Parents for Childhood Abuse?
description: How can we forgive others who have hurt us deeply? Pastor John gives three practical suggestions for pursuing forgiveness.

title: I’m Terrified of Giving Birth — Should I Still Pursue Marriage?
description: The fall has made childbirth painful and dangerous. But in Christ, the deepest dangers of the curse have been removed.

title: How Do I Survive This Midlife Crisis?
description: God keeps his children through midlife crises by empowering them to keep fighting to be kept.

title: Is God Just as Sovereign over Damnation as Salvation?
description: What role does God play in the redemption and damnation of sinners? Is he just as sovereign over both?

title: What Is a Father’s Role in Caring for an Infant?
description: A godly father will want to show God the Father to his children. He will want to model for them the heart of Jesus.

title: Would God Be Less Glorious If He Never Created?
description: If God created the world to display the fullness of his attributes, would he have been less glorious without creation?

title: Is God Angry at Me When I Sin?
description: We go from a rebel against the King to a child of the King. God’s attitude toward us completely changes. But does he still get angry at us when we sin?

title: The Heart of the Calvinist-Arminian Divide
description: Both Calvinists and Arminians see grace as powerful and necessary, but not in the same way. Pastor John gets at the heart of the theological divide.

title: What Is the Baptism of the Holy Spirit?
description: If you are a Christian, then you have the Holy Spirit. But is this the same as being baptized in the Holy Spirit? Pastor John explains the difference.

title: How Do I Trust God with the Eternal Destiny of My Child?
description: We know God will accomplish his purposes for good, but he doesn’t promise our children’s eternal good. How can we be satisfied in God with this unknown?

title: Does God Ever Soften a Heart He Has Hardened?
description: When we think God has hardened someone’s heart, we should not assume that the hardening is permanent. God can and does break in and save.

title: How Should a Husband Treat His Quarrelsome Wife?
description: “Better to live in a desert than with a quarrelsome and nagging wife.” What are readers of Scripture supposed to learn from a proverb like this?

title: Should My Boyfriend and I Travel Alone?
description: Is it wise for a girlfriend and boyfriend to travel together and stay in the same hotel? Should they? Pastor John gives three reasons why they shouldn’t.

title: Do Human Technologies Ever Threaten Divine Sovereignty?
description: At any moment, God can put a complete stop to the plans of man. Rebellious human plans never threaten a sovereign God.

title: Was Job a Man or a Myth?
description: Job is a profound book on human suffering, worthy of a lifetime of study. But was Job himself a real, historical character? And does it matter?

title: Why Does God Discipline Some Christians with Death?
description: Why would God take some of his children home as a means of discipline when he could have prevented their sin another way?

title: How Do I Kill My Pride?
description: Faith kills pride by forcing us to look away from ourselves to God to receive the gift of salvation that we could never earn on our own.

title: Do I Need to Love Myself More?
description: Jesus said we should love our neighbors as ourselves. How is this kind of self-love different from the mantra we hear in advertising and social media?

title: How Much Authority Does Satan Have in the World?
description: All Satan’s power is by permission. He has no authority to do anything God does not permit for infinitely wise purposes.

title: Are Christians Righteous or Unrighteous?
description: Are Christians righteous or unrighteous? Pastor John explains two forms of righteousness in Scripture that get to the core of the gospel.

title: Should We Postpone Children While I Finish My Degree?
description: Deciding when to start a family can be complex. Pastor John shares how he and Noël decided, and what biblical truths should inform the process.

title: Why Is It Better That Christ Went Away (John 16:7)?
description: It’s better for us that Jesus is gone. He said so when he left. But why is Christ’s physical absence from us better for us than his physical presence?

title: Will Marriage Cure My Lust?
description: Sex in marriage, just like other physical gifts from God, is not an absolute cure for lust, but it can be a great help in the battle.

title: Can an Elect Person Die Without Hearing the Gospel?
description: Letting the truth of election deter evangelism isn’t only illogical, but unbiblical. Pastor John shows how election moves us to action, not inaction.

title: Should a Gay Couple, Once Converted, Stay ‘Married’?
description: The union of two men or women is not “gay marriage.” It’s no marriage. When they come to Christ, that former relationship has no binding authority.

title: Is It Sinful to Want to Die?
description: Pain surrounds us in this world, and for those in Christ, the exact opposite awaits us after we die. Is it sinful to want to die and be with Jesus?

title: Should We Expect Revival or More Social Decay?
description: Scripture tells us that the last days will bring an upsurge of evil in the world. Does that mean we should stop expecting revivals to take place?

title: How Does the Gospel Speak to Self-Hate?
description: The Bible has a lot to say about the issue of self-hate. Where should we begin if we’re talking to a non-Christian who struggles in this area?

title: Does Christ’s Righteousness Cover My Joylessness?
description: Jesus is our substitute, the one who became sin so we might be saved. So does his righteousness also cover our joylessness?

title: Does God Direct All the Details of My Life?
description: God’s sovereign control is complete, not partial. He governs every aspect of nature, every aspect of history, and every aspect of personal life.

title: What Does It Mean to Live ‘in the Flesh’?
description: Over ninety times, Paul speaks of “the flesh.” So what does this word mean to the apostle? Pastor John forms a definition from two key passages.

title: Is Cremation Okay If I Give My Body to Science?
description: We testify to the hope of resurrection when we choose burial over cremation. But if we first donate our body to science, is cremation okay then?

title: Does Junk Food Dishonor God?
description: When it comes to food, many of us are in greater danger of judging people where we shouldn’t than of eating what we shouldn’t.

title: I Want Jesus to Be My Treasure — Is the Wanting Enough?
description: Our satisfaction in God will be in measure, not in fullness, until the day we see him face-to-face.

title: My Joy Is So Short-Lived — How Do I Make It Last?
description: God promises lasting joy. But what should we do when we feel full on Sunday but empty by Monday?

title: What’s the Significance of Simon Carrying Jesus’s Cross?
description: Matthew, Mark, and Luke all tell us that Simon of Cyrene helped carry Jesus’s cross. What’s the significance of this story?

title: Where Was the Holy Spirit on Good Friday?
description: At the cross, the triune God was at work, securing our redemption. But what role did the Holy Spirit play in Jesus’s crucifixion?

title: Is There Any Place for Fear in the Christian Life?
description: Fear does not govern the Christian life. But we have a skewed view of the Christian life if we exclude fear.

title: How Does God Answer Today’s Skeptics?
description: Many of today’s skeptics ask questions that God himself has already addressed. Sometimes, we just need to hear how God responds to his critics.

title: How Do Christians Survive in Middle-Class America?
description: “Woe to you who are rich. Woe to you who are full now. Woe to you who laugh.” What do Jesus’s woes mean for middle-class Americans?

title: What Is the Sovereignty of God?
description: God’s sovereignty over all creation is one of the grandest themes in the Bible. Pastor John overviews some of the basics.

title: Why Have Kids If They Might End Up in Hell?
description: Every child is an eternal being, someone who will live forever. So if our children may end up in hell, would we be better off not having kids?

title: I’m Eager to Pastor Now — Should I Skip Seminary?
description: With so many urgent spiritual needs in the world, is it wise to spend years of life in a seminary classroom? If someone is eager for ministry, why wait?

title: Why Did Jesus Need to ‘Become Superior’ to Angels?
description: If Jesus is God, why does the Bible say that he “became” superior to angels? Hasn’t he always been superior to angels?

title: How Much Can Christians Learn from Non-Christians?
description: Christians can learn many important facts from non-Christian teachers. But they cannot learn the most important facts — or how to love them.

title: He Killed His Wife and Children — Can He Really Be Forgiven?
description: Chris Watts murdered his pregnant wife and two daughters. A few months into his prison sentence, he said he found God. Can he really be forgiven?

title: Does the Old Testament Alienate the Disabled?
description: In the Old Testament, the disabled were excluded from the holy place. In the New Testament, Jesus touched and healed the disabled. Why the difference?

title: Why Does God Choose Some and Not Others?
description: God could have chosen all to inherit eternal life, but he didn’t. So why would God choose some and not choose others?

title: Money, Mardi Gras, and Something Far Better
description: Dozens of countries are experiencing a resurgence of biblical Christianity. Pastor John shares several stories from his recent trip to Brazil and Argentina.

title: Can a Coin Flip Reveal God’s Will for My Life?
description: Making a decision with a coin flip glorifies chance. But making a decision from a renewed mind glorifies God.

title: My Girlfriend Affirms Homosexual Love — Is This a Deal-Breaker?
description: “My girlfriend affirms homosexual love — is this a deal-breaker?” Yes. Pastor John gives five reasons why.

title: What Does Jesus Mean by ‘I Never Knew You’?
description: When Jesus says, “I never knew you,” he means, “I don’t recognize you as my disciple, as my follower. You are a spiritual stranger to me.”

title: My Husband Is Passive — What Can I Do?
description: God may use you to change your spouse. But if you press in to him, no matter how disappointed you are in marriage, he will certainly change you.

title: How Do I Break My Entertainment Addiction?
description: As God’s child, you are not enslaved to entertainment or anything else. Christ has purchased a way out for you.

title: How Much Entertainment Is Too Much?
description: Watching a movie, playing a board game, reading a novel — is God disappointed if we use free time for these instead of reading Scripture and praying?

title: I’m an Anxious Person — How Do I ‘Rest in Christ’?

description: How do we teach our children to respect our God-given authority, while also treating them with Christlike humility and servant leadership?

description: Seminary professors need to be more than competent exegetes, linguists, or theologians. They need to embody the pastoral office.

title: Does God’s Happiness Depend on Mine?
description: When one sinner repents, God and his angels rejoice in heaven. Does that mean that God’s happiness depends on ours?

title: What Value Is the Old Testament to the Christian Life?
description: All Scripture is profitable — not just the pages of the New Testament. But how should Christians read the Old Testament in light of Christ’s coming?

title: Does God Love the Non-Elect?
description: God has a special love for his adopted children, but that does not mean he has no love for those who reject him.

title: Do Non-Christians Ever Please God?
description: Can a non-Christian ever please God? If not, how should we understand the account of Cornelius in Acts 10?

title: What’s Wrong with Dressing Immodestly for Attention?
description: When billboards, TV commercials, and even dolls tell women that beauty comes from tight, trim-cut clothing, how can we cultivate beauty in the heart?

title: To Discouraged Pastors and Their Wives
description: What should a pastor do if he feels discouraged, defeated, and almost ready to quit? Pastor John gives a series of diagnostic questions.

title: Why ‘Falling Out of Love’ Never Justifies Divorce
description: Staying married is not first about staying in love. It’s about keeping a covenant that reflects Jesus’s own commitment to his bride — the church.

title: Deep Bible Reading Strategies for the Tired and Busy
description: Deep study of Scripture yields deep payoffs, but many of us can’t engage in rigorous study every day. So how do we strike a proper balance?

title: A New Year, A New Bible Reading Plan
description: We need to read large sections of Scripture and stop to meditate on short passages. Pastor John recommends a reading plan that allows you to do both.

title: I’m Retired and Want to Do Missions — What’s My First Step?
description: Retirees, what a glorious exchange it would be to give up our golf game and bridge club for the mission field. But where should we start?

title: Where Is Heaven Right Now?
description: We can say with confidence God does not dwell in a geographic place we could go to in a spaceship. So what can we say about the location of heaven?

title: Why Did Jesus Need to ‘Learn Obedience’?
description: Why does Hebrews tell us that Jesus needed to “learn obedience” and “be made perfect” if the Bible also says he never sinned?

title: Why Christmas Never Lives Up to the Buildup
description: Christmas may fall short now, but one day our delight will be full — and it will go on increasing for all eternity. This is what Christmas is all about.

title: Do I Love God for His Gifts or for Who He Is?
description: Every good gift we receive comes through the death of Christ. So every gift from God is an opportunity to enjoy God himself.

title: Did Jesus Diminish His Divine Power to Become Human?
description: Jesus is one hundred percent God, one hundred percent man. This union of divinity and humanity may be mysterious, but it’s the only hope for sinners.

title: Keep Close to the Heart of Christmas
description: Let’s stay close to the heart of Christmas: God took on flesh that he might die to destroy our enemies, deliver us from sin, and give us eternal life.

title: To Live Is Christ — What Does That Mean?
description: The key to magnifying Christ in life and in death is to find him more precious and more satisfying than everything we lose in death.

title: What Is the ‘Sin Not Leading to Death’ in 1 John 5?
description: The only kind of sin that does not lead to death is the sin that we confess, repent of, and resolve to fight by God’s grace.

title: Can I Leave and Cleave If We Live with My Parents?
description: In many cultures, married couples live with the husband’s family. But does “leaving and cleaving” mean they should move out and get their own place?

title: How to Live Wisely in the End Times
description: George Ladd has done more to shape our view of the end times than almost any other theologian. Pastor John explains the man and his influence.

title: We Are Accountable for What We Know
description: “Everyone to whom much was given, of him much will be required.” Did Jesus intend this warning for believers or nonbelievers?

title: When Do Christians Resist a Government That Kills Its Citizens?
description: By default, Christians should submit to public officials. But how should Christians respond to rampant injustice in government?

title: To Whom Did Jesus Pay Our Ransom?
description: If Christ died to pay our debt, whom did he pay? Did he pay Satan in order to free us from captivity, or did he pay God to free us from our penalty?

title: Did Public Controversy over the Nashville Statement Hurt the Cause?
description: The Bible’s view of human sexuality is a beautiful truth that we should set on a pedestal — even if that means others hate us for it.

title: Does Hebrews Tell Us to “Grow Up” Beyond the Gospel?
description: We don’t ever outgrow the gospel. So why does Hebrews call us to “leave behind the elementary doctrine of Christ and go on to maturity”?

title: How Do You Structure Your Prayer Life?
description: On any given day, innumerable needs surround us that all call for prayer. So how do we navigate these endless needs and decide what to pray for?

title: Does God Decree Events He Doesn’t Want to Happen?
description: If nothing happens outside of God’s control, then why is this world filled with events that clearly oppose God’s revealed will?

title: How Do I Glorify God in My Job?
description: Most of us spend at least forty hours a week at work. So how do we leverage our time there to bring honor and praise to God?

title: How Do I Process Personal Criticism?
description: Aim to be humble rather than defensive when it comes to criticism. Only then will we be able to listen to their words and change if we’re wrong.

title: Why Does Gossip Feel So Good?
description: Spreading damaging reports about others feels so good and comes so naturally. But why is this impulse so natural? And how do we fight it?

title: Am I Wrong to Prepare for a Nuclear Doomsday?
description: Under the threat of nuclear war, we could easily start preparing for the worst by stocking up on food and building a bomb shelter. But should we?

title: Why Does God’s Sovereignty Make Some Ambitious and Others Apathetic?
description: Why do some hear of God’s sovereignty and run into the mission field with confidence, while others passively say, “What will be will be”?

title: How Do I Love God More Than My Entertainment?
description: What should we do if the thrills of TV, movies, video games, and sports feel more interesting than spending time with God?

title: The Dignity of Those with Dementia
description: Dementia may turn God’s people into frail shadows of their former self, but these saints are sitting on the brink of a glory and power we can’t imagine.

title: Six Common Ways Preachers Dishonor God’s Word
description: The stakes are high when pastors do not root their points plainly from the text in front of them. Here are six consequences.

title: How Do I Know If I’m Loving My Wife Well?
description: The Bible calls husbands to lead their wives. But where should you go for help if you’ve never seen anyone model Christlike leadership in the home?

title: Church Membership Has Left Me Relationally Jaded
description: Even the best churches and friendships can leave us feeling relationally jaded. So how can we persevere in love when others disappoint us so much?

title: Is God a Megalomaniac?
description: God seeks our worship, not because it meets his need, but because it meets ours. God is the only one beautiful enough to satisfy us forever.

title: How Much of My Happiness Is Settled by Factors Outside My Immediate Control?
description: Someone recently claimed that 88% of our happiness is outside of our control. How should a Christian hedonist evaluate this theory?

title: How Martin Luther Built a Brand That Changed the World
description: The Reformation spread when an unknown monk leveraged a rudimentary piece of technology developed by a devout Roman Catholic.

title: What Are the Best Reformation Biographies?
description: Good biographies expose us to times, people, and thinking outside of our own day. Here are some of the best biographies of Reformation figures.

title: Why the Reformation Remains Relevant After 500 Years
description: Choosing which of the five ‘solas’ is most important is like choosing which wing of an airplane matters most. All the ‘solas’ stand or fall together.

title: Is Anyone Born a Racist? Or Is It Learned?
description: Racism, hate, and anger have all erupted in fresh ways this last year. Are we born with these ethnic prejudices, or do we learn them?

title: Is Knowing God’s Sovereignty Important to My Daily Life?
description: The Bible not only recognizes that God controls everything. It also demands that we build our lives around that truth.

title: God Is Holy and Righteous — Are Those the Same?
description: What is the difference between God’s holiness and his righteousness? And what does that mean for us?

title: Ephesians 1:18: Who Will Receive the Riches of Heaven?
description: Is Ephesians 1:18 about God inheriting believers, or is it about believers inheriting God’s glory? Pastor John offers a few defenses for his view.

title: Confronting Emotional and Verbal Abuse in the Home
description: God did not design marriage for outbursts, verbal putdowns, or raised voices. If this describes your marriage, here’s some advice from Pastor John.

title: Is It Harmful to Date in High School?
description: Falling in love is a wonderful gift, but for most the maturity to handle a relationship of that depth doesn’t come in high school.

title: The Great Marriage Killer
description: Anger destroys relationships, but the Bible has a category for righteous anger. So what’s the difference between the good version and the deadly one?

title: Reading Is Agonizing for Me — How Can I Study the Bible in Small Bits?
description: Hearing the word of God is not a mere discipline — it is a matter of life and death. But how can we take in God’s word when reading feels like a chore?

title: The Lord’s Supper — Somber or Cheerful?
description: Communion calls to mind the most tragic event in the history of the world and the greatest hope ever offered. Only mature believers can set that tone.

title: What Does It Mean to ‘Abide in Christ’?
description: Jesus is clear that abiding in him is not optional. But what does it actually mean to daily remain attached to him?

title: What’s the Origin of Desiring God’s Slogan?
description: This slogan became the heartbeat of Pastor John's life and the hallmark of Desiring God’s ministry. So where did it come from?

title: Did Adam and Eve Sin Before the Bite?
description: The ultimate sin in the garden was not eating the fruit. Adam and Eve lost their taste for God’s beauty before they reached for the tree.

title: Does God Control All Things All the Time?
description: We know that God has the ability to control everything, but does he always choose to exercise his full sovereignty?

title: Popular Author Stumbles — What Should We Do With His Books?
description: All authors are flawed, but what should we do with an author’s work when a public failure discredits them as a sound teacher?

title: Are We Called to Thank God for Our Severest Suffering?
description: We don’t have to pretend we don’t feel pain from our losses. Grieving with hope means something far greater than moving on from the pain.

title: What Is the Kingdom of God?
description: Jesus focused a lot on the kingdom of God. But what is the kingdom? And why does the rest of the New Testament hardly mention the theme?

title: Are Small Churches Less Fruitful?
description: A pastor’s job is not to count how many people come on Sunday, but to make faith-filled, self-denying, fruit-bearing disciples.

title: How Did I Fail My Unbelieving Children?
description: Parents will fail hundreds of times as they strive to raise their kids biblically. So how can we find hope in the midst of these many shortcomings?

title: Has Marriage Become My Idol?
description: God never designed marriage to be our ultimate treasure. Here are some signs that we have made our marriage into something God never intended it to be.

title: Did God Choose Me Because He Loved Me or Love Me Because He Chose Me?
description: God’s love and election work hand and hand. There’s no election that is not loving, and there’s no initiating love that is not electing.

title: Six Questions to Ask Before You Binge on Netflix
description: When thinking about TV, music, or movies, don't ask, “What’s wrong with this?” but, instead, “Will it maximize my holiness?”

title: Is Wartime Living the Same as Minimalism?
description: Wartime lifestyle seeks to glorify God — not to live with the least amount of stuff. It simply admits that life must be different during a battle.

title: If Someone Doesn’t Like Me, Have I Ruined My Christian Witness?
description: When is it right to please people? When is it wrong to please people? Motive matters.

title: Am I Single Because I’m Defective?
description: God has designed marriage to bring about a kind of cherishing that emerges nowhere else. But that doesn’t mean you are uncherishable if your single.

title: Local Atheist or Modern Pharisee — Who Is the Greater Threat?
description: Jesus faced more opposition from the Pharisees than the Romans. Are religious formalists a greater threat to the church today than our secular neighbors?

title: How to Stay Christian in College
description: Students, attending college means stepping out into the front line of the war for your faith. In order to hold fast, arm yourself for battle.

title: Our Wedding Date Is Set — Why Not Have Sex Now?
description: God created sex for marriage. He designed it as beautiful gift and placed it precisely where he knew it should be.

title: Is God’s Grace Really Free, or Does It Cost Me Everything?
description: We by nature don’t delight in God but in his gifts. New cars, our job, even our phones all compete for our supreme joy unless God transforms our hearts.

description: One way to honor our parents is to love them as we love ourselves. If we would hope to be helped in our old age, we should find ways to help our parents.

description: Members of our churches learn truth not only from the sermons they hear, but also from the songs they sing. Lyrics on Sunday morning matter.

title: Do All Religions Lead to God?
description: Jesus provides the litmus test for all religions. Any religion that refuses to worship him is a false religion.

title: Should a Single Parent Get Married?
description: Two parents are better than one. But does God require a single parent to marry if he or she doesn’t desire marriage?

title: My Best Life Now?
description: Following Jesus brings suffering we could have avoided. But the alternative is losing your soul while only gaining the cheap pleasures of the world.

title: Does John Piper Overplay Bible Literacy?
description: Was Piper right to say, “You don’t have a chance against the devil unless you know how to read and understand God’s word”?

title: Should We Memorize Catechisms or Scripture?
description: A catechism can help children interpret the Bible, point them to important Scriptures, and capture the whole counsel of God’s word.

title: Why the Coming Kingdom of Christ Is Really Bad News
description: For millions of people, the future reign of God is terrible news. His rule will not be an invitation to eternal joy, but a final verdict: eternal damnation.

title: Glorifying God in Unshakable Grief
description: Joy will come, even when it feels like the pain will never end. In the meantime, God promises to be near you in ways you can’t feel outside of suffering.

title: “My Life Feels Pointless”
description: Our aging bodies and nearness to death need not sap the joy that God gives us while we remain on earth. He still has a purpose for us.

title: Does My Sex Life Affect My Prayer Life?
description: When couples temporarily suspend sexual intimacy for the purpose of prayer, they say with their bodies how desperate they are for God to answer.

title: “I Had an Abortion”
description: Those who have had an abortion should own the guilt, but they should not stop there. God has more than enough grace reserved at the cross.

title: Soul Care for Exhausted Young Mothers
description: Moms, your walk with God is as essential for the good of your children as the milk you feed them and the diapers you change.

title: Does God’s Pursuit of His Glory Ever Detract from His Love?
description: Our deepest, sweetest joy will not come from God making much of us, but from God freeing us to make much of him forever.

title: Should I “Dream Big” for God When I Have a Huge Ego?
description: Egos do not shrink when we stop dreaming big. With big, small, and even stagnant dreams, we will need to kill our self-promoting instinct.

description: Sleep shatters our God complex because we have to put down our tools, take off our boots, and remember that God is the decisive worker, always.

title: Can I Remarry If My Spouse Dies? Should I?
description: Widows and widowers should feel no pressure to rush into a remarriage, but they shouldn’t exclude the possibility either.
