description: The goal of any change in a local church is to shepherd people into a deeper love for God. We must not lose sight of that in our zeal to align with God’s word.

title: Should Patriotism Have a Place in Church?
description: A Christian’s first identity is with the King of the universe, not with any country or nationality or political party or governmental regime.

title: How Is Jesus Both Joy and Master?
description: The Bible calls us to serve God, but we must remember that we can only do that because God first came to serve and help us.

title: How Do I Study a Specific Topic in the Bible?
description: Studying the Bible does not need to be complex. Simple tools can help us glean amazing insights from the word.

title: Jesus Said He’d Return Soon, So Where Is He?
description: A careful study of New Testament prophecy should never lead us to assume that Jesus and the apostles were wrong about the timing of Jesus’s return.

title: How Can I Better Study a Bible Passage?
description: “Think over what I say,” commands the Lord. How can a faithful student of the Bible do this without leaning on commentaries and scholars?

title: What Can We Say to Friends Facing Suffering?
description: When suffering drones on and on, what can we do to stay steadfast in our call to share in this suffering?

title: How Do I “Give My Life to God”?
description: Settle it in your mind and heart whether you believe Christ purchased you. If so, you are utterly dependent on God for life, meaning, and satisfaction.

title: I Know God Loves Me, but Does He Like Me?
description: If you live in the flesh, you will never please God. But those who have the Spirit delight God as they bear fruit. Even the small harvests please him.

title: Did Israel’s King Consult with a Witch?
description: God’s people must not consult with mediums — not because there’s no such thing as communication with the dead, but because it is an abomination to do so.

title: When Do I Unfollow My Pastor?
description: To be united to God is to be united in principle and in love to the people of God. We don’t choose between belonging to God and belonging to his people.

title: How Do I Escape Regret over Hurt I’ve Caused?
description: Don’t be paralyzed by feelings of regret. Rather let those very feelings empower you with a sense of greater grace, gratitude, and joy in God’s grace.

title: How Do I Follow Big Sections of Scripture?
description: As you study the Bible, study larger portions by looking for similarities in the sections that fit together.

title: The Only Solution to Spiritual Blindness
description: Spiritually dead and blind people are willfully dark. It’s what they prefer. Therefore, they can only be rescued by a divine miracle.

title: What’s the Point of Your New Trilogy of Books?
description: John Piper believes nothing is more important for his remaining years than to focus on the authority and the meaning and the heralding of God’s word.

title: God’s Work in Your Depression
description: Depression is not simply black and white. There are many degrees of discouragement, and God is able to provide help in them all.

title: Will You Ever Write a Piper Bible Commentary?
description: Good commentaries should ask and answer questions that enable people to see things for themselves, and probe into reality, not just verbal relations.

title: My Sin Feels Good in the Moment — Why Stop?
description: God commands us not merely to flee evil, but to hate evil — not merely to do mercy, but to love mercy.

title: Can We Be Legalistic About Not Being Legalists?
description: Christ’s righteousness is the sole ground of our acceptance into God’s favor, but our new life of holiness is necessary to demonstrate that we are truly in him.

title: Is Body Image My Idol?
description: Pursuing physical fitness becomes sinful self-glorification when we no longer do so to overcome our own sin, serve others, and glorify Christ.

title: Will You Write More Biographies?
description: Tell stories of Christians to inspire others to love Jesus, give them insight into perplexing difficulties, and motivate them to follow him no matter what.

title: What’s the Difference Between ‘Foolish’ and ’Sinful’?
description: Foolishness in the Bible is always sinful. To act foolishly is sin, and to sin is to act foolishly.

title: Can I Forgive Someone Who Doesn’t Confess Wronging Me?
description: Renounce revenge, trust your cause to God, and return good for evil. You can do that whether your adversary admits wrong or not.

title: Is Homosexuality Really the Worst Sin?
description: The blood of Christ is sufficient to wash away every sin and remove all judgment and bring us to everlasting healing and joy.

title: Why Does John Piper Complicate Saving Faith?
description: To come to true saving faith, you have to experience the miracle of spiritual sight of the supremely valuable glory of Christ, the image of God.

title: Explaining Hell to Our Children
description: God intends for our real and wise fear of hell to be a means of clarifying and establishing his glory and truth in our hearts.

title: How Will God Judge What I Do Today?
description: Teachers need to be vigilant over what they teach, and all Christians need to be vigilant over what they do with what they are taught.

title: Is John Piper Happy?
description: The promise of future joy penetrates back into the present and sustains us with joy now in the midst of sorrow.

title: Three Strategies for Overcoming the Superficial Life
description: Our tragic loss of wonder and amazement is epidemic, especially in our age of ever-present distraction by superficial input from every manner of media.

title: God Made Me — So Doesn’t He Owe Me Salvation?
description: Thinking that God owes us naturally leads to arrogant abuse. But knowing that we deserve nothing good from God naturally leads to brokenhearted love.

title: Does the Bible Prescribe Alcohol to the Depressed?
description: Don’t open your mouth to alcohol to numb your pain. Open your mouth to speak right things that would deliver you from misjudgment.

title: Is Male Headship a Lost Cause?
description: There will always be complementarians willing to die for the truth who will give their lives rather than conform to an unbiblical culture.

title: How Do I Love My Unbelieving Spouse?
description: The key to persevering in a discouraging marriage is hope and faith from God’s word that he can overcome the divide.

title: The Glory of Good Friday
description: Christ was a just and merciful substitute for sinners. When he died for his elect, he bore their punishment. They experience no condemnation.

title: The Horror of Crucifixion
description: Studying the historical and physical realities of crucifixion shows how deplorable and inhumane that form of human extermination is.

title: What’s the Last Thing You Would Tweet?
description: Jesus, God’s Son, died in the place of sinners and rose so that all who love him supremely might be forgiven all and have eternal joy in God.

title: Campus Ministry and the Local Church — Do They Work Together?
description: When parachurch campus ministries are an extension of the local church, they can strategically reach and disciple the lost together.

title: How Do Finite Beings Worship an Infinite God?
description: God does not require finite man to love him infinitely. But he does require total and supreme love.

title: Was Calvin a Christian Hedonist?
description: Because John Calvin loved the glory of God and our pursuit of happiness in him, John Piper believes he would have been a Christian Hedonist.

title: Should Christians Vacation to Religious Shrines?
description: It is a terrible sign of spiritual obliviousness to visit religious shrines and not feel heartbreak and caution for demonic powers of deception.

title: My Parents Say Missions Is a Waste of American Blessings
description: If your parents think pursuing missions is a waste, win them to your vision and show them that Christ is sufficient to satisfy your soul.

title: What’s the Appeal of Heavenly Rewards Other Than Getting Christ?
description: Christ is our reward — as is everything else that more fully reveals him and more fully enables us to enjoy him.

title: Should We Baptize the Dead?
description: Baptism demonstrates and symbolically reenacts our spiritual death, burial, and resurrection in Christ. But it does not save anyone.

title: I’m Confused — Are We to Pray with Few Words or Without Ceasing?
description: Pray to God at all times, but don’t think you can twist God’s arm by repeating your requests. He seeks heartfelt, authentic fellowship.

title: How Can My Difficult Marriage Glorify Christ?
description: A faithful, covenant-keeping spouse can display the truth of Christ’s covenant with us — even after a failed marriage.

title: Do We Really Need Musical Worship?
description: Qualified leaders should help God’s people come together to express his infinite value by lifting their voices and hearts in song.

title: When Should Christians Use Satire?
description: While satire, irony, sarcasm, and ridicule all have their place in exposing evil and harm, Christians should patiently seek to win others in love.

title: Why Does the New Testament Cite Extrabiblical Sources?
description: Sometimes biblical authors drew in material from outside the Bible in order to strengthen their points for their audience.

title: What Is Revival and Where Do We Find It?
description: Revival is a concentrated work of God where Christians in various churches earnestly desire more of Christ, boldness in witness, and commitment to missions.

title: Why I’m Baptist
description: First, be a Bible-guided Christian. Second, embrace the Bible-rooted doctrines of grace. Third, come to your convictions on baptism.

title: My Prodigal Left Home — Should I Give Him Money?
description: If you have a prodigal, immerse yourself in the Bible and pray with your spouse for wisdom, love, boldness, and joy.

title: Is God Ever Surprised?
description: God is never ignorant about the future or about anything. He is never uncertain about what is coming. He is God.

title: What If Life Turns Out to Be Pointless?
description: Christianity and nihilism are exclusive, because God himself is the meaning and purpose and value of human existence.

title: Am I Really Ready for Heaven?
description: Receive Christ, the one who did all the doing that had to be done as the foundation of our acceptance with God.

title: Does God Know the Exact Day I Will Die?
description: God determines when everybody dies. He decided so before the world existed.

title: How Soon Is Christ’s Return?
description: If Christ’s millennial reign comes after his second coming, Jesus could come very, very quickly.

title: Can We Ever See God or Not?
description: There are some senses in which God’s people can see him, and other senses in which they cannot.

title: Will Every Jew Be Saved?
description: Not all Israelites will be saved, and no Jews who are waiting for a Messiah but rejecting Jesus while they wait will be saved.

title: How Many Bible Versions Should I Read?
description: Use multiple Bible translations for increased general understanding, and use one main translation for meditation and memorization.

title: Is Pain Punishment for My Sin?
description: The purpose and design of God’s justice in punishment is infinitely different than his purifying discipline in pain.

title: Do Pets Distract the Christian Life?
description: While pets, like other good things, can distract us from the glory of God, they can also provide God-saturated fascination and joy.

title: Never Send Nude Selfies: Seven Reasons
description: Nudity belongs in marriage, and nowhere else — not in dating, not in engagement, and certainly not on your phone. Pastor John gives seven reasons why.

title: How Do I Pray the Bible?
description: Praying the Bible keeps us from focusing on our immediate private concerns to the exclusion of God’s larger purposes.

title: Was Jesus a Christian Hedonist?
description: Jesus lived to glorify his Father by enjoying him as the sustaining power for all his life, including his greatest suffering.

title: Can I Be Faithful to God and Popular at School?
description: Imitate Christ and ask yourself, “How can I serve somebody today?” not, “How can I get somebody to like me today?”

title: Will Some People in Heaven Have More Joy Than Others?
description: The greatness of our rewards in the age to come correspond with the life of obedience that we have lived here.

title: Can Loved Ones in Heaven Look Down on Me?
description: Although we don’t know how much our loved ones in heaven can watch us, we do know that they would encourage us to fix our eyes on Jesus.

title: Was Any Biblical Writer Aware He Was Inspired?
description: The Bible is God’s word not simply because the authors said so, but because of the way God’s glory shines through it.

title: What If I Ruin My Kids?
description: When God calls a woman to be a mother, it is a glorious calling, and such women should consider and embrace those glories.

title: Christ Reigns over All: Biblical Survey of God’s Kingdom
description: The ultimate hope for all Christians is the new heaven and the new earth, where everyone will see God as King over all.

title: Help! My Teen Is Abandoning Christ
description: If your child has turned from Christ, don’t despair. God loves to hear your prayers and can meet your situation with power.

title: What Does It Mean That God Will Glorify Me? And How?
description: If you find praise from other people more satisfying than praise from God, you will not be able to believe on Jesus.

title: Are Men Superior to Women?
description: With every difference between men and women, there is a kind of counterpoint of indispensability.

title: I’m Exhausted — How Do I Recharge My Body Without Neglecting My Soul?
description: If you are a weary pastor, ask God to protect you from wasted leisure and to help you pursue God-honoring refreshment.

title: Don’t Waste Your Engagement
description: Engagement is a golden opportunity for men to set patterns of spiritual leadership and talk with their ladies about biblical and spiritual realities.

title: Did John the Baptist Advocate Divorce?
description: Some people use Matthew 14:4 to justify divorce. But Piper shares three uncertainties in the text that should keep us from doing so.

title: Am I Holy Enough to Take Communion?
description: If you are a member in good standing at your local church, renounce sin, and treasure Christ, then you should eat the Lord’s Supper with hope.

title: Will I Be Single for the Rest of My Life?
description: God promises to give his single children an everlasting monument and name better than sons and daughters.

title: Is It Sinful to Seek Fame Online?
description: We must not find satisfaction in the praise of men, but in God himself and in helping others find that same satisfaction.

title: Why Are Women More Eager Missionaries?
description: More single women serve in missions than single men, but God is able to give grace for every circumstance.

title: How Does a ‘Man’s Man’ Sing to a ‘Beautiful’ Jesus?
description: When we see all of Jesus’s virtuous capacities and magnificent achievements, it is natural, not awkward, to call him beautiful.

title: The Sacrifice of Christ in the Season of Christmas
description: We must see how sacrifice works as a theme in all of the Bible in order to fully appreciate the cross of Christ.

title: John Piper’s Favorite Hymn
description: And it’s a rather obscure German hymn you’ve probably never heard — until now.

title: Santa Claus: Harmless Fun or Tragic Distraction?
description: If being Jesus-focused is a killjoy for your Christmas, you don’t know him well.
