description: Diets and quick-fix programs for weight loss don’t work because weight loss is actually a spiritually battle that requires us to get our hearts right first.

title: God’s Glory Must Enchant Us
description: God’s astounding glory and majesty should awe us. If we don’t live with a fearful sense of his glory, then we miss one of our greatest paths to intimacy with God.

title: How Do You Humbly Receive Harsh Feedback?
description: We all need constructive criticism to help us grow and mature. But how do we respond to feedback that seems harsh, and perhaps downright rude?

title: If We Have the Holy Spirit, Do We Need Other Teachers?
description: God has granted us his word and his Spirit to guide us into all truth. Does that mean we don’t really need anyone to teach or instruct us in the ways of the faith.

title: What Is ‘Glorified Joy’ and Can I Get It?
description: The Bible speaks not only about joy but “inexpressible joy” and “glorified joy.” Is it really possible for us to experience such bliss on this side of heaven?

title: How Do You Synthesize Your Simple Lifestyle and Speaking at Expensive Conferences?
description: Christian ministries often spend significant amounts of money on conferences, marketing, and other things that can seem excessive. Do such expenses align with a wartime lifestyle?

title: What Is Discipleship and How Is It Done?
description: We all know the call to make disciples of all nations, but where do we start? And how do we know if we have actually succeeded?

title: What Truths Do We Need from Outside the Bible?
description: Scripture is sufficient, and yet there is a lot that we can learn from natural revelation. How do we evaluate those truths not contained in the Bible?

title: How Do We Know We Cannot Sin in Heaven?
description: If Adam and Eve sinned in the paradise of Eden, how do we know we won’t sin in the next paradise of the new heavens and the new earth?

title: How Christ Sensitizes Us to Reality
description: In a 2015 message, Pastor John preaches that the gospel brings life, and in this life comes sensitivity to reality, and there is great sadness in reality.

title: Can I Be Blotted from the Book of Life?
description: Several passages in Scripture mention being blotted out of the book of life. Does this mean genuine believers can lose their salvation?

title: Is God Sovereign over My Free Will?
description: We do not have ultimate self-determination, but we will all give an account to God for our choices.

title: Why Was Jesus Baptized?
description: Jesus clearly stated that he needed John to baptize him. But why would Jesus need to go through the waters of baptism if he had not sinned?

title: Humbly Handling the Offense of the Gospel with Non-Christians
description: In a pluralistic world, Christianity faces all sorts of backlash against its exclusive claims. How can we respond well to the claims of other religions?

title: Who Is Jesus to You?
description: Jesus Christ is the Alpha and the Omega. He never had a beginning and will have no end. He is fully and completely God.

title: Four Ways to Kill the Sin of Habitual Suspicion
description: Sometimes it’s too easy to question others’ motives, especially if we think they want something from us. How do we fight that tendency to suspicion?

title: What Does It Mean for a Man to Lead His Family Spiritually?
description: Husbands take their cues from Christ, who gave himself up for the church. How can Christian men serve their wives and kids while leading them?

title: Will God Call Me to a Career I Don’t Enjoy?
description: Can a believer ever be called to a lifelong career that they do not enjoy? Pastor John explains why we should ask a different question.

title: Strategies for When Life Seems Aimless
description: When seasons of waiting make you feel aimless and without purpose, what truths from Scripture can keep you moving forward.

title: What’s the Most Neglected Spiritual Discipline?
description: Which spiritual discipline can help awaken our appetite for God, but is rarely practiced well today?

title: What Spiritual Disciplines Are Most Important?
description: Taking in the word of God and talking to him in prayer are the most basic, fundamental disciplines. But is there a way to do both of those better?

title: How Do I Know If I’m Doing the Spiritual Disciplines Right?
description: Discipline is a mark of a believer in Jesus Christ. The Holy Spirit gives us new desires to see and savor Jesus Christ wherever we can find him.

title: Why We Need Personal and Congregational Disciplines
description: The spiritual disciplines are habits to be engaged in personally and corporately. We need time alone with God, and we need time together with his people.

title: What Are Spiritual Disciplines?
description: What makes a discipline spiritual, and what makes a spiritual practice a discipline? Don Whitney addresses six characteristics of Christian spiritual disciplines.

title: What Are the Biggest Challenges Facing the Evangelical Church in 2016?
description: Every generation faces unique issues, but the most pressing, most urgent Christians remain the same year in and year out.

title: Why Sexual Metaphors of Jesus and His Bride Embarrass Us
description: Marriage — including sexual intimacy — portrays Jesus’s relationship with the church. Pastor John explains how.

title: Are We Saved by Belief in God or by Delight in God?
description: Faith, defined biblically, not only believes in Jesus Christ but also treasures him as the supreme value of all the universe.

title: The Key to Experiencing Christmas Peace in Your Life Today
description: Christmas is a time for relishing in the peace that God offers the whole world through Jesus Christ, but we will only have it if we put our faith in the one who took on flesh that first Christmas.

title: Glory to God and Peace on Earth
description: The birth of Jesus at Christmas enables glory to ascend forever to God and peace to descend on his people forever.

title: Santa Claus: Harmless Fun or Christmastime Diversion?
description: Compared to all the riches of knowing Jesus Christ, even the best gift Santa could bring is little more than a lump of coal.

title: Truth or Fiction: Did Herod Really Slaughter Baby Boys in Bethlehem?
description: Matthew’s Gospel recounts Herod’s infanticide of baby boys in Bethlehem, but no other historical sources appear to mention this tragedy. Did it really happen?

title: Should Missionaries Fundraise?
description: Lots of missionaries raise their own support for ministry. Does the Bible have any examples of this kind of support-raising that we can look to as a model?

title: Does the Cross Show How Valuable I Am?
description: Does the cross of Christ show how valuable we are? Or how enormous sin is that we need a Savior?

title: Four Signs Food Has Become an Idol
description: When our contentment in God fades, food quickly takes its place. Pastor John focuses on the secret to winning the war for our desires.

title: I Will Not Leave Jesus — But I’m Done with the Church
description: “I’m done with the organized church, but I still love Jesus.” If you walk away from the church, you walk away from Jesus.

title: Should I Hate Satan?
description: We know Satan has been working evil since the beginning. But should we actually hate him? Pastor John explains why we should.

title: Where Did Satan’s First Desire for Evil Come From?
description: We may not be able to explain how Satan became evil, but we do know that God did not compromise his goodness or glory in allowing Satan’s fall.

title: I Read the Bible and Feel Nothing — What Should I Do?
description: Never settle for passionless Bible reading. Lean in, pray for God to open your eyes, and keep searching for treasure for your heart.

title: Do I Own My Art? On Intellectual Property Rights
description: Are property and intellectual rights selfish, or do they actually match up with clear biblical principles?

title: You Have a Lawyer in Heaven’s Court
description: Our salvation isn’t just a once-and-done event, but a lifetime of drawing near to God through Jesus Christ, our high priest.

title: What Does It Mean to Live in God’s Presence?
description: For Christians indwelt by the Spirit, God is always in us and with us. But sometimes, he exerts his influence for our good in unique, unmistakeable ways.

title: How Do I Know God’s Calling for My Life?
description: Should I stay and send, or should I go to the mission field? Pastor John gives seven factors to keep in mind when weighing a calling to missions.

title: Counsel for Online Shopping Addicts?
description: Shopping today is more convenient than ever, especially online. But what should we do when online shopping becomes more than just a convenience?

title: The Holy Kiss — Relevant Today or Not?
description: The New Testament mentions greeting one another with a kiss four times. Is that just an outmoded cultural practice, or is there something we can learn from it today?

title: Your Suffering Is Working for You
description: For every believer, we can know with complete confidence that God is not only with us sin our pain, but is producing glory through every ounce of our suffering.

title: Is God Directing My Life Through My Anxieties?
description: God can use anything he wants — even sin — to lead and guide his people. But that doesn’t mean we should seek out sinful means just because God can sovereignly use them.

title: When Am I Ready to Become a Christian?
description: I’ve heard the gospel, but how can I be sure that I am truly ready to surrender my whole life to Jesus Christ?

title: What Will My Happiness Look Like in Heaven?
description: God offers all of his children joy in Christ now. But compared to heaven, those are just mere glimpses of what is to come.

title: Christian Joy and Feasting
description: Throughout the Scriptures, God’s people feast as an expression of their joy in the Lord. What would it look like for the church to be known for celebration and joy?

title: The Two Sworn Enemies of Our Joy
description: Sin and anxiety threaten to still our happiness every day. Thankfully, Jesus offers us greater pleasure than sin and an antidote to all our worry.

title: If God Is Happy, Why Does He Seem Bad-Tempered?
description: As we read the Bible, we see a God who is righteously angry at sin. But we can’t let that overshadow the reality that God is a fundamentally happy being.

title: Is Happiness Different from Joy?
description: We often hear that joy and happiness are fundamentally different. But does this idea actually hold up to the way the Bible presents the concepts of happiness and joy to us?

title: What’s the Point of Thinking Deeply About God?
description: If we are inclined to embrace emotion more than thinking, what biblical truths might help us embrace a balance between passion and intellect?

title: When Should Non-Quitters Quit?
description: Do I dishonor God when I quit something that I have committed to? What if that commitment prevents me from doing other things that honor the Lord?

title: Even in Setbacks, God Is Lacing Your Life into an Infinite Storyline
description: So much of our lives seem ordinary, or even trivial. But the truth is that nothing done for Christ’s sake is ever ordinary.

title: Four Key Ways We Enjoy God in Our Work
description: Our vocation isn’t something we do apart from efforts to know and enjoy God. Rather, our work should be the very sphere where we publicly enjoy and show off the glory of God.

title: Articulating the Glorious Cross to an Atonement-Rejecting Culture
description: Substitutionary atonement may not appeal to modern sensibilities, and even seems unjust to some. But if we lose Christ in our place, we lose the gospel.

title: Am I Righteous Enough to Enjoy the Promises in the Psalms?
description: The psalmists regularly plead their own righteousness before God. Can Christians today do the same, even though we know just how sinful we really are?

title: Do I Delight in God or in Others Being Impressed by My Discovery About God?
description: In our personal communion with the Lord, we want the highlight of our time to be worship an adoration, not just more ideas and notes for our next sermon or Bible study.

title: What Does It Mean to Receive Jesus into My Life?
description: If God gave his only Son, then that means that we must receive him. But what does it really mean to receive Jesus Christ?

title: Nine Forceful Warnings to Confront Your Friend’s Adultery
description: Pursuing romance outside of marriage might seem like it offers a path to pleasure and joy, but in the end, it obscures the only way to life and sets you on a road to destruction.

title: Six Ways Parents of Rebellious Children Fight for Faith
description: Every believing parent longs to see their children walking with the Lord. But what can a mom or dad do when their son or daughter rebels?

title: Gun to Your Head, Will You Deny Christ?
description: Would we really stand for Christ in the moment our life is on the line? What if we’re really not sure?

title: Is Tardiness and Punctuality a Christian Witness Issue?
description: Tardiness may not seem like a big deal, but when it becomes a habit, it can really disrupt someone’s life. So how can brothers and sisters in Christ help each other deal with chronic lateness?

title: Hope in Eternal Purity, Aim at Daily Purity
description: The new birth changes our status before God and how we act in the world. We now fight for purity as adopted children of the Most High.

title: Can My Life Be Plagued by Generational Sins, Hexes, or Curses?
description: Christ has freed all his people from any and every Christ. All who take refuge in him need no longer fear any generational sin, hex, curse, or anything else.

title: How Do I Praise Others but Avoid Flattery?
description: The Bible calls us to encourage one another, but how do we prevent encouragement and praise from devolving into flattery?

title: No Creed But the Bible?
description: If Scripture is the Christian’s primary guide, then why do we need confessions of faith? Shouldn’t we just stick to the Bible?

title: The Major Obstacle in Forgiving Others
description: Even when others won’t acknowledge the wrong they have committed, Jesus still calls his people to love, forgive, and forebear.

title: Would You Settle for One Million Dollars?
description: The inheritance we have in Christ far outvalues anything this world can offer. Our eternal treasure is safe and secure in him.

title: Why Do Non-Christian Novelists Know the Human Condition So Well?
description: When we reject God, we suppress the truth. But we can never escape all that is true, good, and beautiful in our Father’s world.

title: Knowledge Exists Because God Exists
description: God has known himself perfectly for all eternity, and now he knows every aspect of his world perfectly. So as we come to learn and discover, we are simply thinking God’s thoughts after him.

title: Does God Delight in Destroying Sinners?
description: The Bible seems to say that God does not take pleasure in death, and yet that he takes delight in executing his wrath. Is this a contradiction, or can they both be true?

title: Everything About God Is About Everything
description: Nothing exists that does not relate directly to God. In other words, everything about God is also about everything in this world.

title: When Depression Descends, Do the Next Thing
description: Do not underestimate the power of preaching to your soul and singing to God when you can’t shake spiritual darkness.

title: How Should Christians Think About Socialism?
description: How does socialism borrow from the Bible? And how does socialism differ from biblical principles on compassion and justice?

title: Is the Refugee Crisis an End-Times Event?
description: As peoples spread and migrate across the globe, Christianity ebbs and flows. But there is no reason to believe that God won’t use the movement of peoples to advance the gospel.

title: Should I Care at All What People Think of Me?
description: Christ frees every believer from being overly concerned with what others think. But that doesn’t mean we shouldn’t care at all.

title: God Wrote a Book — That Changes All Other Books
description: Good books have so much to offer for the Christian life. Pastor John describes seven ways books have shaped him personally.

title: Loving Money Is Suicide
description: We all need money and we all use money. But when we begin to seek happiness in money, we are taking steps toward destruction.

title: What’s the Difference Between Self-Love and Self-Esteem?
description: Jesus commands us to love others as we love ourselves. Does that mean he wants us to have high self-esteem?

title: Eight Promises to Students Facing Ridicule at School
description: How can a student face persecution from their peers at school? What promises can they hold on to when all seems to be shaking?

title: Do Arminians Preach a Sufficient Gospel?
description: Spurgeon seemed to say that Arminians preach an insufficient gospel. But can our theological commitments really ruin our gospel presentation to the point that it’s completely defective?

title: Is God Only Glorified by People Who Love Him?
description: God will receive glory from every part of his creation, even from those who rebel against him. But he receives most glory from the believer when our hearts find our fullest satisfaction in him.

title: Consistent Spiritual Discipline Is Not Legalism
description: Consistent spiritual discipline is Christian living and is not legalistic.

title: Does the Bible Say True Christians Never Sin?
description: Some texts in the Bible, like 1 John 5:18, may seem difficult to understand at first. But with a little digging, nuggets of gold are sure to surface.

title: Doesn’t the Cross Display God’s Wrath Better Than Hell?
description: If Christ already bore the wrath of God on the cross, then is hell just redundant? Does hell take away from the glory of what Christ accomplished?

title: Don’t Neglect the Work of Speck Removing
description: Before correcting a brother or sister in Christ, how certain must we be that our own outlook is free from sin and deceit?

title: Can God Be Sovereign over All Sin and Still Be Good?
description: How we talk about God’s absolute sovereignty, right down to our word choice, makes a big difference in how people receive this precious truth.

title: Does Netflix Make Christ More Precious to You?
description: The accommodations of our modern world aren’t all inherently sinful. But unless they serve our faithfulness to Jesus, what good are they?

title: Should Christians Start Revolutions or Just Live Quietly?
description: First Thessalonians 4:11 says that we should “live a quiet life.” Do Jesus’s and Paul’s lives measure up to that instruction?

title: Will God Ever Give Us More Than We Can Handle?
description: Many Christians say, “God will never give us more than we can handle.” But the truth of that statement depends on two key words.

title: What’s the Difference Between Peace and Joy?
description: God desires that we have both peace and joy as we walk with him. How to joy and peace relate, and how do they differ?

title: When Should We Pray for God to Take Us Home?
description: When we learn that our time on this earth is short, what truths can help us live out our last days with joy?

title: Truths You Will Need When Cancer Hits
description: The Bible speaks to our toughest moments.

title: Seven Tips for College Students
description: Do what you have to do to be radically devoted to Jesus and his holiness.

title: How to Help Friends Escape the Prosperity Gospel
description: The prosperity gospel may be easy to critique from a distance, but what about when it comes home? How can you talk to close friends and loved ones who have accepted the so-called prosperity “gospel”?

title: How to Survive a Zombie Apocalypse
description: What if zombie stories and movies weren’t just mindless horror but could actually teach us about the true nature of our world?

title: If My Work Can Be Used for Evil, What Should I Do?
description: If my work can be corrupted by others for evil purposes, does that cancel out any good that I achieve?

title: The Only Escape from Our Boasting
description: We love to enjoy the benefits of the gospel, but the gospel is actually not an end in itself. So what is the ultimate goal of the gospel?

title: If My Government Funds Abortions, Why Pay Taxes?
description: Our tax dollars inevitably end up at places like Planned Parenthood — an organization that takes innocent life. Is it wrong to continue contributing taxes to a government that underwrites sin?

title: If Babies Go to Heaven, Why Oppose Abortion?
description: Some argue, “If aborted babies go to heaven, why is abortion such a big deal?” Pastor John gives six reasons why Christians must never compromise.

title: How to Engage Culture and Swim Against It
description: As you swim in the culture, be a dolphin that cuts through the currents, not a jellyfish that goes with the flow.

title: Are Comfortable Christians Compromisers?
description: When everything in life is going well, should we be worried because we are not experiencing the suffering Scripture promises?

title: The Love You’ll Never Get from Hollywood
description: The love of God in the Bible can sometimes be difficult to understand, like when Jesus lets Lazarus die because he loves him. What is love in a passage like that?

title: Hope for Hard Marriages
description: If you are in a discouraging marriage, don’t focus on whether your marriage is pleasing to the Lord. Focus on whether you are.

title: Should Energy Drinks Fuel the Christian Life?
description: When thinking about energy drinks, we need to ask if the stimulant is masking a deeper problem, becoming a new master in our lives, or harming other people.

title: How Does God’s Forgiveness Free Us from Idols?
description: In a fallen world, we will never rid ourselves completely from the threat of and allure of idols. But the gospel has the power to free us to live from security and stability.

title: Why Are Relationships Thin in the Digital Age?
description: Social media allows us to connect with high numbers of people, but often those relationships remain thin. For security in our identity, we need depth, not just breadth.

title: Has My Phone Become My Idol? Three Diagnostic Questions
description: How do I know if my smartphone plays too prominent a role in my life? Dr. Richard Lints offers pointed questions to help you diagnose your screen time habits.

title: Why Are Control Freaks Prone to Idols?
description: We all desire control. But when we realize that we are far from having any real control over our lives, we look for something we can easily manipulate — like a smartphone.

title: Why We Never Find Our Identity Inside of Ourselves
description: In an individualistic era, we like to think that we can just be who we are. But in fact, we are only who we are in relation to others — and most especially in relationship to God himself.

title: How Often Should We Voice Our Views on Homosexuality Online?
description: When addressing contentious cultural issues like homosexuality, Christians should never merely voice our opinions. We are stewards of God’s very grace and truth.

title: When Should We Vent over Social Sins?
description: Outcries over social ills say something about God, but so does silence. So when should we vent over social sins?

title: How Is God Directing My Life?
description: God’s words lead us to the path of life. They help us see that God is sovereign, a shelter for the needy, and a treasure to those who love him.

title: When Should I Get Rid of My Smartphone?
description: Our smartphone will not destroy us. But our love for it can. Ask the Lord to make it plain when the time has come to get rid of your smartphone.

title: If I Fail to Forgive Others, Will God Not Forgive Me?
description: The love and forgiveness every believer experiences from God came at the highest price of God’s own Son. How could we ever hold back that grace and mercy from others?

title: The Case for Satan
description: Satan is real. He has massive influence all over the world, and he never tires of wreaking havoc wherever he is able.

title: Does Proverbs Promise My Child Will Not Stray?
description: The Bible never promises that the children of believers will grow up and still follow Jesus. But that doesn’t mean parents are helpless in shepherding their littles ones to the Lord.

title: Our Theology Is Meant to Flatten Us
description: How do you stay humble when God blesses you? How do we guard against pride when others notice that blessing too?

title: What’s the Difference Between Types and Analogies?
description: The Bible uses types to teach us about the single stream of redemptive history that culminates in Christ. But are types really any different than analogies?

title: You Are More Sinful Than You Know, More Loved Than You Imagine
description: Our sin can overwhelm us, leaving us depressed and feeling stripped of value. How do we face our sin honestly without falling into hopelessness?

title: How Culturally Up-to-Date Must My Pastor Be?
description: A pastor can’t be an expert on every news trend, but he can help shape a biblical worldview in his people so they can wrestle with the issues on their own.

title: Should Women Be Police Officers?
description: The Bible prescribes different roles for men and women, but are those roles just for the home and the church?

title: The God Who Commands Our Emotions
description: If telling someone to be happy doesn’t make them happy, then why does the Bible constantly command us to feel a certain way?

title: Watershed Differences Between Calvinists and Arminians
description: The five points tease out the differences between Calvinists and Arminians, but how can parents teach them to their kids simply and clearly?

title: Am I Overworking?
description: The Bible presents a pattern for six-day labor. Whether we follow that same pattern today depends on what we mean by sabbath and how we define our work.

title: How Do I Choose Between Two Good Things?
description: Every person experiences disordered desires. The only hope we have to align ourselves with God’s desires is to pursue God in his word through prayer, all in the context of a community of saints.

title: Biblical Hope for Breakups
description: The identity Christ gives to us guards us from devastation when painful breakups happen. We are secure in Jesus no matter what.

title: The Single Key to Personal Change
description: We can all benefit from practical examples of applying Scripture, but what really drives us toward change is a fresh sight of God’s glory and our place in his world.

title: Why I Chose ‘God Is Most Glorified’ Not ‘Christ Is Most Glorified’
description: The New Testament clearly teaches that Christ should be preeminent in all things. So then why does Desiring God’s slogan not even name him?

title: A Mysterious Naked Guy in Gethsemane, and a Lesson in Bible Interpretation
description: Why does a naked man show up at Jesus’s arrest, and then flee the scene completely naked? Pastor John offers some hermeneutical principles for interpreting seemingly strange texts like this one.

title: How Christian Is ‘Pay It Forward’?
description: The call to “pay it forward” may promote kindness and goodwill, but is it Christian?

title: Battling Doubt and Cynicism in Our Bible Reading
description: Doubt can hijack our time in the word, turning our Bible reading into a battle, not a delight. Where can we turn when this discouragement bombards us?

title: What Is Love?
description: The most beautiful love is God’s love, which paid the highest price — the life of the Son — to give undeserving enemies the greatest happiness.

title: Is Yoga Sinful?
description: When it comes to yoga or anything else, don’t simply ask, “What’s wrong with this?” Ask the much fuller question, “Will this make me more Christlike?”

title: Living Out God’s Design for Marriage in Today’s World
description: When we enter into the covenant of marriage, we inevitably bring baggage with us. But God gives grace for us to learn and grow and flourish together.

title: How Do I Explain Sin to Someone for the First Time?
description: In a pluralistic, postmodern culture, the concept of sin can prove difficult to understand. Where should we begin in helping others understand this essential tenet of the faith?

title: Why We Must Understand the Temple in God’s Plan Today
description: “Temple” is a theme that runs throughout the entirety of the Scriptures. How do we trace it, and how does this thread help us understand the whole Bible?

title: What Is Biblical Theology? And Do We Need It?
description: Biblical theology isn’t just theology derived from the Bible, but is a discipline that helps us understand the unique contribution of each part of Scripture to the unified whole.

title: Should We Learn to “Forgive Ourselves”?
description: We no longer have to bear the burden of our guilt. God offers the verdict of no condemnation to all who are in Christ.

title: Should My Spouse Talk to Others About Our Marriage Struggles?
description: Every marriage has struggles, but how open should we be in sharing those problems with others close to us?

title: He or She? How Should I Refer to Transgender Friends?
description: Does love demand that we agree to call our transgender friends by their preferred gender title?

title: What About Soft Cussing?
description: What we speak with our mouths ought to reflect the purity we strive for with our bodies and the love for God and neighbor we want to exude with our whole being.

title: A Song for Sufferers
description: Under God, none of our suffering is ever meaningless. Whatever comes our way, yet shall we hope in him.

title: Should We Prep Our Testimony or Let It Flow?
description: When the opportunity comes to testify to Christ’s goodness, we don’t always need a rhetorically sound presentation. We need to overflow from faith-filled communion with our Lord and Savior.

title: Don’t Waste Your Mornings
description: Checking our phones first thing in the morning won’t prepare us for the day ahead. Our routine should set our eyes on, and strengthen us in, God alone.

title: Why Not to Check Your Phone in the Morning
description: Every morning we wake up with a craving — a craving our phone is eager to satisfy. But this temporary snack cannot feed us like the bread of life.

title: What Are We Saved for?
description: In the gospel, we receive forgiveness and salvation, but also so much more. The end point of the good news is pure joy in the presence of God forever.

title: Is My Bible Reading Too Academic?
description: Rigorous study of the Bible doesn’t have to be cold and detached. Rather, intense intellectual work can fuel worship for God and love for others.

title: Put Your Phones Away at the Dinner Table
description: Mealtimes should offer a time for families to enjoy one another’s company. But what if phones get in the way?

title: Why Are Old Testament Commands No Longer Binding?
description: Christians refrain from keeping the Old Testament law code not because we ignore Scripture, but because Jesus Christ fulfills the whole law.

title: Can Souls Be Scared into Heaven?
description: If we come to Christ simply to receive his gifts, then we have actually missed the greatest gift God can bestow: himself.

title: Where Do All Our Prayers Go?
description: Pray is not only a means for us to commune with our Creator, but is God’s appointed means by which his kingdom will come and have victory.

title: Does Hebrews 6 Say the Gospel Is Only for Beginner Christians?
description: The cross is the ground of all that God does in redemptive history, which means that the cross should be the basis for all that we preach and teach in our churches.

title: How Should We Respond to Calamity in the News?
description: When tragedy strikes, Christians have need to know how to respond. So how does the Bible guide us to think, feel, and act in the face of calamity?

title: What Is the Daily Aim of Parenting?
description: In the trenches of day-to-day parenting, we need to remember the big picture — namely, that we have the unique opportunity, under God, to shape a form a human soul.

title: Do I Love Money? One Simple Test
description: Money may allow us to buy stuff, but it can never buy contentment. If we try to use money to purchase our happiness, it will fail us every time.

title: God Takes Away to Display Christ’s Beauty
description: The Lord takes away not so that we experience loss, but so that we know the fullness of hope and joy only Jesus Christ offers.

title: Flee from Delusions of Strength
description: God’s grace is sufficient for our every weakness — even the subtle weakness of taking pride in our own “strength.”

title: The Church’s Role in Sexual Mythology
description: Sex isn’t a topic the church should be embarrassed about. In fact, our God-given sexuality offers us an opportunity to display fundamental truths about God and his world.

title: What Porn-ified Culture Does to Marriage
description: When sex becomes all about “my pleasure,” it corrupts a pleasure that God intended to be shared and enjoyed in close, intimate relationship.

title: What Sex Outside Marriage Says About You
description: God has set boundaries for sex not because he wants to deny us some hidden pleasure, but because he wants us to experience the best joy possible.

title: Postmodern Nonsense Meets Palpable Evil
description: What happens when a postmodern perspective on good and evil collides with a breathtaking tragedy like the holocaust?

title: Life Is One Big Glory War
description: Our hearts have a natural drive to seek glory. But unless we find that desire in God, we will never experience the satisfaction we so crave.

title: Pleasure Is Only Protected by Pleasure
description: Unless our pursuit of pleasure has proper boundaries, we’ll always come up short of the lasting joy we’re looking for.

title: Should We Pray for ISIS to Be Saved or Destroyed?
description: Jesus tells us to love our enemies and pray for those who persecute us. But what about enemies who constantly kill and destroy innocent life like ISIS?

title: The Emotional Complexity of the Christian Life
description: God has deep purposes in our most searing pains. We don’t always know what he is doing, but we can experience joy in the sorrow when we trust him.

title: Has God Called Me to Write?
description: To write with a calling from God isn’t simply to enjoy putting pen to paper, but to have an insatiable drive to awaken delight in God with whatever you say.

title: Don’t Conversations Illuminate Truth Too?
description: The process of writing — putting thoughts into words and sentences and paragraphs —  clarifies our thinking in ways that dialogue simply cannot.

title: Do Bad Ethics Qualify as Heresy?
description: Doctrine and ethics are never far apart. The beliefs and views that lead distort one will inevitably corrupt the other.

title: Hope in Heaven Changes Today
description: The hope of heaven not only grants us comfort when we think of eternity, but also empowers our love for God and Neighbor today.

title: The Key to Ministry Longevity
description: The resolve to keep moving forward in ministry doesn’t come from mere determination, but daily dependence on God’s amazing grace.

title: When Scripture Demolishes Your Theology
description: Sometimes the Bible confronts us and tears down our longstanding opinions. And although the process may hurt, being refined by God’s word is always worth the cost.

title: Can We Trust the Bible?
description: God’s world shines with his glory — and so does his word. Just as the heavens declare God’s greatness, so his word overflows with the beauty of his majesty.

title: How Much of My Decision-Making Is Emotional?
description: When it comes to making God-honoring decisions, our greatest problem isn’t necessarily that we don’t think enough, but that we don’t have hearts and emotions that treasure God above all else.

title: How Do I Study Bible Verses and the Bible Storyline Together?
description: As we study the Bible, we want to go deep into the details of specific texts, and we want to get a broad overview of the whole. How can we do both in a limited amount of time?

title: Getting the Tough/Tender Balance Right
description: We need more pastors with both theological backbones of steel and compassionate hearts of warmth. In short, we need more pastors like our Lord Jesus Christ.

title: How Much of My Sinful Past Should I Tell My Children?
description: Should a parent share their past sins with a child to comfort or warn them? Or are parents better off just keeping their sins to themselves?

title: What Qualifies as Worldly Music?
description: The Bible repeatedly calls Christians to set their minds on what is above — on what is true and good and beautiful. But does that mean we need to avoid anything that isn’t obviously Christian?

title: The Books That Most Shaped @TripLee
description: As a writer and musician, Trip Lee reads regularly to spark his creativity. So what three books have influenced his life most?

title: Procrastination Is Pride
description: We may assume that we can always just do something later, but God never guarantees a “later.” We must make the most of the time we have now.

title: How to Be Insecure for the Rest of Your Life
description: We will never find security if we think we have what it takes to make it through life. Only God himself can provide the fullness of hope we desperately long for.

title: Don’t Be a Jerk When the World Doesn’t Like You
description: God calls Christians to stand firm in the truth, but that doesn’t excuse us for being jerks when our culture turns against us.

title: Avoiding Smartphone iDolatry
description: Our phones offer us plenty of convenience, but it comes at the price of distraction. Sometimes we need to step back and make sure we control our phones and that they haven’t mastered us.

title: Watching On-Screen Nudity Is Not Worth It
description: Explicit sexuality and nudity are pervasive in our culture. And because it’s everywhere, Christians need to guard their souls more than ever.

title: Joy, Faith, and Self-Denial
description: We may sometimes be tempted to think that God is just a cosmic killjoy with lots of rules. But in reality, he is working for our highest joy, even when he asks us to deny ourselves.

title: Why Fame Cannot Make You Happy
description: We can use social media as a tool for good, but all too often, the likes and retweets can consume us. How do we get sucked in so easily?

title: The Daily Fight for Joy in Christ
description: Joy in the Christian life doesn’t usually come without a struggle. We have to fight to delight in the Lord on a daily basis.

title: When Trials Kill Your Dreams
description: True strength doesn’t come from having the energy to do everything we want to accomplish. According to the Bible, when we are weak, then we are strong.

title: Can Jesus Really Understand My Temptations?
description: Jesus did not have a sinful nature like ours, but that doesn’t mean he can’t identify with our temptation. He was tempted as we are, but had to remain without sin to save us forever.

title: How Does God ‘Deliver Us from Evil’?
description: Jesus teaches us to pray that the Father would deliver us from evil. But what exactly does God deliver us from, and does he do it?

title: Spend Your Life to Build a Risk-Taking Church
description: The world around us isn’t impressed with a church that lives just like everyone else. What they need to see are people who daily breathe the air of another world.

title: Have I Cast My Anxieties or Hoarded Them?
description: First Peter calls us to cast our anxieties on the Lord. But how can we know if we have really given over all our stresses and burdens to him?

title: Why Is Radical Islam Alluring to Westerners?
description: The human heart longs to be part of a God-sized cause, and radical movements like ISIS tap into those innate desires to lure and recruit.

title: Does God Favor Boys over Girls?
description: God values men and women alike, and so should his people. So does that mean we shouldn’t pray specifically to have a boy or girl when expecting a child?

title: What to Say to a Pastor Who Wants to Officiate a Gay Wedding
description: Same-sex “marriage” is simply not permissible according to Scripture. And for a pastor to marry a same-sex couple is to bless eternal suicide.

title: The Fear That Haunts Humanity
description: We may not always know it consciously, but the fear of death motivates much of how we live. But what if we could be liberated from that primal fear and live to the full?

title: Is Marriage Eternally Futile?
description: In 1 Corinthians 7, Paul commends singleness for the sake of the Lord. But does that mean that the married life is somehow less than the single, missionary calling?

title: The New Book John Piper Wrote
description: The Scriptures not only tell us about God and his works, but shine with their own peculiar glory that open our eyes to vistas of majesty.

title: How John Piper Writes Books
description: Just because John Piper has written so many books doesn’t mean they come easily. In this episode, he offers more tips for the writing process.

title: How John Piper Prepares to Write Books
description: John Piper has written dozens of books, but that doesn’t mean the process is easy. So how does he begin laboring on a book project?

title: Life Is Hard. God Is Good.
description: The clouds of suffering may darken the light for a time, but the steadfast love and mercy of the Lord never ever ceases.

title: Your Job Is Not Your Savior
description: Sabbath is not only a principle for rest, but the context from which we live. We work and play and have our being from the grace of rest in God.

title: iPhone Fasting
description: In a digital age, a constant barrage of information can crowd out what matters most. Maybe we could all benefit from a break every once in a while.

title: How Facebook and Twitter Change Us
description: The digital frontier presents countless opportunities, but also sobering dangers. Christians need wisdom to think through how technology shapes and impacts our faith.

title: A Battle Plan Against Pornography
description: We can fight pornography, but we have to want to battle it. We need a plan and some backup from fellow soldiers if we hope to see victory.

title: Can My Good Works Outweigh My Bad?
description: Not even the greatest good deed earns us anything with God apart from faith. We have favor with God on the basis of Jesus Christ alone.

title: Fear, Anxiety, and Growth in Godliness
description: When fear and anxiety creep up, we can cling to the most precious promise of all: God is with us, and he hears us.

title: Can I Grow in Holiness Without the Church?
description: The local church is essential to our growth in holiness. We need our brothers and sisters in Christ to spur one another on to love and good works.

title: The Root of Sinful Anger
description: Anger creeps up when we try to take God’s place. He is the only judge and lawgiver, and so we can relax our grip a bit on what pains and troubles us.

title: Battling Anxiety Is a Blessed Struggle
description: To our fears, God speaks beautiful promises. And the most precious of all may just be that he is with us, always and forever.

title: Sin Prefers Anything to God
description: God deserves our highest allegiance, but too often, all we do is belittle him by choosing to find our hope in joy in something else.

title: Vision for the Local Church in Exile
description: Christians may live in exile, but we still have opportunities to serve and seek the welfare of wherever God has placed us.

title: Strategy for Social Media
description: Social media often draws out division and gossip — but it doesn’t have to. Christians can use their platforms to encourage and sustain.

title: Easter Breaks Our Mediocrity
description: The gospel isn’t just a solution to our sin, but a key that unlocks the fullness of life and joy that God desires for all his people.

title: Easter Breaks Our Sin
description: Jesus Christ not only came to rescue us, but in his humanity, he identifies with his people and paves the way for us to know God’s redeeming grace.

title: Easter Breaks Our Heartbreak
description: Sin and suffering can set us back and even break our hearts. But in our risen Lord Jesus Christ, we have a hope that shines through even the darkest night.

title: Why Gossip Destroys
description: We may like to think that words can never hurt us, but in fact, Proverbs tells us that “death and life are in the power of the tongue.”

title: Helping Our Children Feel Loved by God
description: Parenting can feel exhausting and tough. But our homes should overflow with the glorious goodness of God, because that is the ultimate foundation of reality.

title: How to Regain Your Joy in Christ
description: God beckons his children to cast every care upon him, and to feel afresh the good news of the gospel in the communion of saints.

title: You Will Submit to Something, Why Not Scripture?
description: The Bible is no mere book. For Christians, the Scriptures are the scepter of the King: how he rules and reigns among us.

title: The Heart of Screen Addiction
description: Sin not only suppresses the light of the truth, but also exchanges true glory for the false hope of idols — which, in our age, are often found on a screen.

title: The Secret to Marriage (Word to Husbands)
description: The secret of lasting marriages is the biblical call to "rejoice in the wife of your youth." Remembering the spouse you feel in love with produces thankfulness for who God gave you.

title: Word of the Day from Jonathan Edwards
description: Jonathan Edwards wrote frequently about the “excellency” of God and of Christ. But what does “excellency” mean, and how does it help us understand God?

title: Does God Want Me to Be Happy or Holy?
description: Our happiness in God never has to contradict our obedience to God because to delight in God is to obey him, and to obey him is to find lasting joy in him.

title: What Would You Ask Jonathan Edwards?
description: John Piper has said that, outside of the Bible, Jonathan Edwards has influenced his life and theology most. So, if given the chance, what would he ask his hero in the faith?

title: Look at Christ, What Do You See?
description: We don’t come to Christ simply by making a decision for him. God needs to give us a fresh sight of his infinite, all-satisfying beauty and worth.

title: Read Old, Dead Theologians 15 Minutes a Day
description: Reading serious theology takes time and commitment, but the world needs more people who read deeply to nourish their soul, not just inflate their heads.

title: Are Christian Hedonists Happier Than Unbelievers?
description: If there is no resurrection, then Christians haven’t just wasted their lives. We’ve misrepresented God and falsely taught in his name.

title: Is Permanent Birth Control a Sin?
description: Is permanent birth control a sin? Pastor John draws on principles for marriage, sex, human life, and the sovereignty of God.

title: Is Joy in God the Same as Love for God?
description: Joy is essential to the Christian life, but it’s not the only component. From our hearts’ delight in God flows the desire to please him in the ways we think and act.

title: Why Do We Preach and Sing?
description: Christianity isn’t simply a way of life or a new morality. Christianity is about the best news in all the world that we now herald in word and song.

title: Will Some Saints Be Happier in Heaven?
description: The New Testament speaks of varying degrees of reward in heaven, but that doesn’t mean there will be any envy or boasting. All will experience fullness of joy in their own capacity.

title: How Do I Honor God in Chronic Pain?
description: Injury doesn’t have to impede our ability to grow in and witness to Christ. God wants to use our weakness for his glory.

title: If God Is So Happy, Why Did He Create the Non-Elect?
description: We may not always know precisely why God does what he does, but we can always trust his infinite wisdom, righteousness, and justice.

title: How Do I Explain Election over Brunch?
description: The doctrine of election isn’t just a point of theology to study, but a profound truth that awakens amazement for all God has done.

title: Finding the Courage to Be Christian
description: What Jesus Christ offers in the gospel isn’t merely a band-aid for sin, but everlasting joy that outweighs any and every earthly pleasure.

title: How Do I Take My Thoughts Captive?
description: Left to ourselves, we cannot discern or remove the flaws in our thoughts. But God’s word and the Holy Spirit can renew our minds.

title: Do I Tithe to My Church or to God?
description: When we give money to our churches and to God through them, we need to always remember that every desire and ability to serve and give are themselves gifts from God.

title: What to Do When God Feels Distant
description: When we feel no joy, when we go to Scripture and walk away discouraged, when God feels distant, what can we do?

title: Does the First Sin Undermine Christian Hedonism?
description: Pastor John teaches how the first sin displayed a heart that did not trust nor treasure God.

title: Don’t Become an Entertainment-Addicted, Approval Junkie
description: When we as a church assume that we are owed cultural dominance and prosperity, our otherworldly hope can quickly begin to fade.

title: Is My Lack of Joy Sinful?
description: Whenever we talk about emotions in the Christian life, like joy, we need to remember that we all experience life differently, and God has grace for all our shortcomings.

title: Advice to Teens About Their Parents
description: When a Christian teen disagrees with their Christian parent, are they both stuck, or is there more to pursue than agreeing to disagree?

title: Do Pets Go to Heaven?
description: Only humans are made in God’s image, and only humans can be redeemed. So do we have any biblical basis for saying our pets will be in heaven?

title: The Dangers of Nostalgia
description: The past isn’t just a source for nostalgia and fond memories, but a reservoir of God’s grace that empowers our faith in all that God has promised to be for us.

title: How to Make a Difference in the World
description: We only have one life on this earth to devote to honoring and glorifying our Lord Jesus Christ. Don’t waste it; make it count.

title: Does Your Theology Drive Your Exegesis?
description: The content of a pastor’s preaching should connect directly with his text. To preach faithfully is to show your people the truths that are really present in a passage of Scripture.

title: Can a Woman Preach If Elders Affirm It?
description: All men and women should be active in ministry. The question is how. Pastor John explains why God reserves Sunday-morning preaching for men.

title: Counsel for White Cops
description: Christian police officers have a God-given platform to advocate for positive change in their communities. Pastor John offers four pieces of advice for speaking on race.

title: What the Church Offers for Race Relations
description: Churches are not social action agencies, but Christ does call his community to embody and witness to the power and values of his kingdom.

title: The Real Cost of Pornography
description: Pornography and lust may seem harmless at first, but, in the end, they may just cost you the most precious gift in all the universe.

title: What Hope Does God Give Lonely Singles?
description: Longing for marriage can be a good, God-given desire. But finding a spouse can never replace our primary life’s passion: seeing and savoring Jesus Christ.

title: Dating and Marriage for the Victims of Past Abuse
description: The Church is made of broken people who look to Jesus for satisfaction and joy. Many in the church experienced sexual abuse and struggle in their relationships.

title: Signs a Single Should Stop Dating
description: To be ready for a dating relationship, a young man or woman doesn’t only need availability and desire, but a growing relationship with the Lord Jesus Christ.

title: Should a Boyfriend “Lead” His Girlfriend?
description: Boyfriends should take the initiative to lead their girlfriends in ways that are appropriate outside the marriage covenant — especially when it comes to sexual purity.

title: Should I Date a Godly Girl I Do Not Find Attractive?
description: Our culture may place a high premium on looks, but what attracts godly people isn’t just the right physical features, but the spirit and character that lay underneath.

title: Should My Church Help Me Get Married?
description: The local church is a community for all kinds of people, including every age group. And members should constantly be looking for ways to learn from and serve one another across generations.

title: Has Facebook Ruined Dating?
description: Matt Chandler joins the Ask Pastor John podcast to discuss the speed of relationships moving toward marriage, and whether social media has negatively impacted dating.

title: Is Your Boyfriend Mature Enough for You?
description: For Christians, the church is the best context for developing relationships because a local community of faith should provide discipleship and accountability like no other place.

title: Prepared Prayers, Impromptu Prayers, Sloppy Prayers
description: Both spontaneous and prepared prayers can edify the health of our spiritual lives, but whenever we pray, we need to aim for glory, rely on God, and speak in the Spirit.

title: You Have Been Greatly Loved
description: When God issues his call to awaken new spiritual life in a once dead heart, he create what he commands out of an overflow of his love.

title: Does Philippians 1:23 Prove Christian Hedonism Wrong?
description: Does the apostle Paul actually chose a lesser joy in Philippians 1:23, and actually contradict the Christian Hedonistic principle of always pursuing our highest joy?

title: What Parts of My Suffering Are “Trials”?
description: Our pain and suffering may result from persecution, or just the troubles of everyday life. Either way, God is at works and desires that we trust him by faith.

title: My Spouse Doesn’t Enjoy Sex
description: Marriage over presents us with a mismatch in sexual desire. But if both husband and wife work to outdo one another in showing honor, sexual intimacy can still bring joy to both.

title: Is Sexual Pleasure Essential for Marriage?
description: Sex and its pleasures may not be absolutely essential in a marriage, but we inevitably lose part of the pointer of Christ and his church when sexual intimacy is absent.

title: Love Jesus over Human Approval
description: Christians don’t need to crave people’s approval because we live every day in the full and lasting approval of our heavenly Father.

title: Are My Septuplets in Heaven?
description: Children who perish before they can understand the gospel don’t have to fear judgment, but are enveloped by the grace of God who saves according to his mercy.

title: Is the Threat of Eternal Punishment Manipulation?
description: When God threatens punishment for our failure to delight in him, he’s not manipulating us, but showing us the urgency of choosing life and joy in him.

title: Why So Few African-American Calvinists?
description: During an era when Reformed theology has seen a resurgence, why does it appear that the embrace of Reformed doctrine is disproportionately white?

title: How Local Church Trumps Twitter and Facebook
description: When Christians lose social influence, we need to remember that opposition is normal, and that our hope for the kingdom never rests with Facebook or Twitter.

title: Your Life’s Greatest Problem
description: What God saves us from isn’t low self-esteem or even just immorality, but his own righteous wrath against sinners.

title: Dads and Family Leadership
description: Parents should monitor their kids use of technology, not just so that they get good grades or avoid trouble, but so that they grow up to live for Christ and his kingdom.

title: Why Christian Singles Are Marrying Later
description: Francis Chan gives reasons why he thinks Christians are delaying marriage.

title: How to Argue with Your Spouse
description: Husbands have a high calling in their homes. And one of the primary ways we can see our families flourish is by humbling ourselves and not insisting on our own way.

title: Why Joy Is Essential to Leadership
description: If joy is a fruit of the Spirit, then any Christian home should strive to be a source of joy, for the family first, and then as an overflow to others.

title: Discerning Maturity in a Boyfriend Before Marriage
description: What matters in a potential significant other isn’t just what they do, but whether they know and love Jesus in a deep relationship.

title: The Christ-Centered Family
description: What matters most in our homes isn’t that our children enjoy everything parents do, but that they come to know and love Jesus more than anything else.

title: Francis Chan’s Daily Fight for Joy
description: Joy in the Lord isn’t automatic, but a daily fight to delight in him. Even prominent leaders like Francis Chan are no stranger to the struggle.

title: Jesus’s Aggressive, Relentless, Surgical Love
description: Our souls thirst for water that will satisfy us fully and forever. We long for the fullness of life that only Jesus himself can provide.

title: Best Piper Books for Beginners
description: Pastor Piper has written dozens and dozens of books Where should someone begin — especially a new believer — if they want to start reading Piper’s work?

title: Incredible Growth in 2014, Goals for 2015
description: Pastor John gives an update about the ways God worked through Desiring God in 2014, and shares goals of the ministry for 2015.

title: Christmas at the Piper Home
description: Pastor John and Noel talk about how they celebrated Christmas in their home as their kids were growing up and their two overarching goals.

title: How Do Men and Women Show Physical Affection in the Church?
description: Establish a principled and emotionally healthy and happy place at your church where people, especially women, feel safe to hug or not to hug.

title: Is God Less Glorified in the Judgment of Sinners?
description: God’s glory does not rise and fall as our effectiveness in showing him glorious rises and falls.

title: How Does Scripture Serve Our Prayers?
description: The most important thing we do every day is make our souls happy in God by praying over the Bible.

title: What Will Submission to My Husband Look Like?
description: Submission is mainly a wife’s intelligent, happy, wise support for her husband’s leadership.

title: The Message of the Magi’s Star
description: We can’t explain precisely what the star of Bethlehem was, but we do know God formed it to bring the nations to their Savior.

title: Is My Relationship with God Healthy?
description: There are certain tests from the Bible that help us know if our relationship with God is a good one.

title: Are New Testament Ethics Final or Trajectory-Setting?
description: If you think the New Testament simply sets a trajectory for ethics, you might effectively strip the Bible of its final authority.

title: Can a Spiritually Dead Soul Thirst for God?
description: Unless the Spirit gives us eyes to see that the true God is beautiful and desirable, we won’t seek him.

title: How Open Should I Be with My Parents?
description: Trusting your parents by being honest is a huge honor to them.

title: Declare War on Sin
description: There is a mean streak in Christianity, and it is not against anybody else but ourselves and our sinfulness.

title: What Arminians Have Helped You Most?
description: Men like John and Charles Wesley, G.K. Chesterton, George MacDonald, and, in a sense, C.S. Lewis have been the most influential Arminians in Pastor John's life.

title: The Camaraderie of Christian Hedonism
description: Christian fellowship does not distract from the supreme glory of God in the believer’s life, it testifies to it.

title: Is My Boyfriend’s Video-Game Addiction a Marriage Deal-Breaker?
description: An addiction to video games says something about a man’s subjection to Christ, state of mind, self-control, and fitness to lead a family.

title: Advice for Fathers of Sons
description: For fathers of new sons, Pastor John summarizes his encouragement: Be a weeping, happy, loving father full of God, full of truth, full of joy.

title: Pray This Daily for Your Family
description: If you want your kids, spouse, parents, coworkers, and friends to know God — if you want to know God — rehearse Paul’s prayer in Ephesians 3.

title: Why Was Adam Lonely If God Is Enough?
description: When we enjoy what God has created, we know and enjoy God more. And when what has been created fails us, our Creator never will.

title: Are We Satisfied ‘in God’ or ‘by God’?
description: We are satisfied in God rather than by God if God is the object of our satisfaction, not simply the provider of it.

title: Doesn’t Prosperity Preaching Glorify Jesus?
description: The prosperity gospel falls short on two counts: It presents a weak God, and it neglects to reckon with the Bible’s teaching on suffering.

title: Are Smart People Less Happy?
description: For the Christian, knowing God’s word and world increases our sorrow — and our joy.

title: Does Happiness Require Apathy to Others’ Sorrows?
description: Sorrow and suffering make up daily life across the world. So what does it look like for Christians to be both happy and sorrowful?

title: Avoid the Unrepentant — But What If They’re Family?
description: How should believers behave toward family members who walk in unrepentant sin but continue to call themselves Christians?

title: A Prayer for Those Stuck in Sin
description: Even if deliverance does not come right away, our prayers are not in vain. If you are stuck in sin, this prayer is for you.

title: Good Motives for Bible Memory
description: Memorizing Scripture offers Christians at least eight benefits, including fostering fellowship with Jesus and combating Satan’s lies.

title: Is Sexual Attraction Essential for Marriage?
description: Sexual attraction is not essential for marriage, but God does call for marital intimacy — both physical and emotional.

title: Must My Wedding Be in a Church?
description: The Bible doesn’t detail the cultural symbols for a marriage ceremony. Does this mean a wedding doesn’t need to happen in a church?

title: Should I Look at Beheading Images?
description: Viewing horrific images may prepare Christians distant from horrors in the world to embrace the sovereignty of God over what is to come.

title: Do You Regret Partnering with Mark Driscoll?
description: What should our response be to Mark Driscoll’s failures? Pastor John unpacks some lessons from his partnership with the former Seattle pastor.

title: Christ Reigns over Every Inch
description: Know the glories and beauties of Christ who reigns supreme over kings and tyrants, over mountains and hurricanes, over time and death.

title: The Role of Family Worship
description: Family worship often includes prayer and reading scripture. But it can also include singing and memorization as you leave a legacy of worship.

title: Can I Confess the Name of Jesus and Be Unsaved?
description: If no one can say that Jesus is Lord except in the Holy Spirit, then why are there people who say, “Lord, Lord,” whom Christ denies ever knowing?

title: Did God Commission Terrorism in the Bible?
description: When the Israelites entered the Promised Land, they slaughtered at God’s command. How can Christians claim the moral high ground over modern genocides?

title: Is My Pastor a Bully?
description: It’s a weighty thing to be a pastor. Shepherds bear greater responsibility. How do we discern when they are abusing their position?

title: Killing Our Addiction to Human Praise
description: When the fresh water from Jesus’s well quenches your thirsty soul, the tepid drink of praise from other people loses its allure.

title: How Do I Go Deeper with Christ?
description: What does Paul mean when he commands us to be “rooted and built up” in Christ? How does he tell us to get there?

title: I’ve Never Read the Bible, Where Should I Start?
description: If you are new to the Bible, the life and ministry of Jesus recorded in the gospels will illuminate the rest of the Bible. Let the adventure begin!

title: Prayers That Don’t Work
description: If Jesus says, “Whatever you ask of the Father in my name, he will give it to you,” how can James say that sometimes God withholds our requests?

title: We Pray to a Father
description: When we pray to God as our Father, we remember he is more than a boss. He is the lover of our still sinful souls, working in us to seek after him.

title: Joy, Sorrow, and the Healthy Prayer Life
description: Our requests, our laments, and even our complaints in prayer have worth in the hands of the God who works sovereignly through them.

title: Fighting for Solitude
description: Tim Keller offers help for distracted believers who struggle to focus their minds and warm their hearts when they pray.

title: How to Pray the Psalms
description: The Psalms can give us spiritual breath that we didn’t even know we needed. Tim Keller offers practical help to pray the Psalms.

title: Encouragement for Slow Readers
description: For some, reading feels like a chore instead of a joy. Audio Bibles open the door to God’s word, even for those who don’t read.

title: The Future of World Missions
description: World missions is the great work of the church, and David Platt exudes a passion to reach the unreached peoples with a massive God behind him.

title: Winning the War Against Lust
description: Fight lust with a stronger weapon than guilt, shame, and fear. Fight lust by feeding faith with the knowledge of an irresistibly glorious God.

title: Why Our Happiness Makes God Happy
description: God doesn’t need anything from anyone, so when we obey God, do we obey him for his sake or for our own happiness?

title: How Do I Fight Same-Sex Desires?
description: Paul said that it is better to marry than to burn with passion. What does that mean for the person struggling with homosexual desire?

title: When Enjoying Money and Possessions Is a Work of Grace
description: The message of Ecclesiastes: Life — and money and possessions — is empty and futile without God.

title: How Does Delight in God Fuel Delight in Creation?
description: More than any other kind of person, Christians are able to delight in creation because they are not bound to worship it.

title: A Prayer to Hold Your Life Together
description: Pastor John points to the purpose of prayer — that God would look great in the world and in the lives of his people.

title: Does God Predestine People to Hell?
description: Predestination to hell is a heavy reality. But what is mysterious to us now will be revealed in the end. And we will see that it is right.

title: Why Are Believers Threatened with Perishing?
description: Even those who claim Christ can show themselves not to share in him if they refuse to repent of their sin.

title: My Church Makes Ministry a Pain
description: The joys of pastoring may ebb and flow, but Pastor John offers ten hope-filled counsels to help pastors press on when ministry proves difficult.

title: How Do I Prepare for the Rapture?
description: Jesus is coming back. Pastor John shares what Christians should do while they wait for his return.

title: Three Motivations to Pray
description: Pray because God tells us to. Pray because it increases our joy. Pray because the sovereign ruler of the universe makes things happen through prayer.

description: The Bible doesn’t include a list of God-approved words. Christians should instead ask, Does my speech exalt Christ? Does it build others up?
