description: Pastor John encourages listeners to settle on a single Bible translation and commends the ESV as his go-to and recommended one.

title: Practical Tips for Bible Memory
description: Andy Davis’s method for memorizing Scripture helps believers on their way to retain long passages one day, and one verse, at a time.

title: Bible Memory: Essential or Optional?
description: We don’t have to memorize the Bible — we get to. Lovers of God delight to read, know, and recite his precious word.

title: What Steals Your Joy?
description: A happy home can empower ministry, but struggles at home can deplete its power. Pastor John shares six counsels for a joyful family and ministry.

title: Dad’s Role in Homemaking
description: Dads joyfully lead their households so that each member can flourish to the fullest extent God has planned.

title: God Heals All Our Diseases — Really?
description: Scripture does not promise deliverance from harm in the present age. But in Christ, we will all get the best healing in the age to come.

title: When Leaders Don’t Affirm Your Ministry
description: What should Christians do when their church’s elders hesitate to put them in a position of leadership?

title: Did Christ Die for the Whole World?
description: When we consider definite atonement, we must always ask, “What do you mean when you say ‘Jesus died for all?’”

title: When Our Heroes Age
description: Billy Graham preached the gospel faithfully. But as he got older, he said some troubling words. So how should we think about our heroes as they age?

title: Billy Graham’s Controversial Ministry
description: Despite controversy, Billy Graham, Bob Jones, and John Piper’s father shared a desire to see Christ glorified and millions saved.

title: When I Met Billy Graham
description: Pastor John relates Billy Graham’s impact on his life, from their personal meetings, to his crusades, to his time at Bob Jones University.

title: Slavery, Oppression, and America’s Prosperity
description: We do not share in guilt, but we do bear the shame of past iniquity in America. We must respond now with a chastened gratitude for unearned blessings and with a zeal to remedy the shame.

title: What Podcasts Do You Listen To?
description: Podcasts stir us up by way of reminder, provide a platform for raw, inviting experiences with God, and help us make the best use of the time.

title: A Little Theology of Resolutions
description: Seeking God requires firm resolve. But should Christians wait until the New Year comes around before making any resolutions?

title: Ghostwriting and Research Assistants
description: In using ghostwriters, authors hide their own weaknesses and put money before the truth. Therefore, ghostwriting is out of step with the way of Christ.

title: Exciting Days Ahead for Desiring God
description: Help through tragedy. Global Impact. App Development. Pastor John reflects on past grace and anticipates future grace to and through the ministry of Desiring God.

title: What Christmas Is All About
description: Before it rings the bell of family, or charity, or gift-giving, or Saint Nick, Christmas sounds the trumpet of God’s salvation for sinners.

title: The Virgin Birth and Human Sexuality
description: If God called human sexuality good, along with the rest of creation, then why did he send Jesus to be born of a virgin?

title: Six Reasons to Skip Tattoos
description: Tattoos may appeal to Christians, even for missional reasons. Pastor John weighs the costs of tattoos against any benefits they offer.

title: Tattoos in Biblical Perspective
description: The question of tattoos involves more than law or culture. It touches the allegiance of our hearts.

title: Why Stoicism Is Toxic
description: Although emotionalism can lead churches into unhelpful practices and even abuse, emotionless churches are in greater danger. Pastor John explains why.

title: Where’s the Arminian John Piper?
description: If God does not sit at the center of your theology, your worship will fizzle out. He made you to delight in him.

title: Where Did All These Calvinists Come From?
description: What factors led to the current rise in Calvinism? Where does Pastor John fit into the picture?

title: I May Be Called to Missions — Where Do I Start?
description: If you feel the slightest tug to go with the gospel to the unreached peoples of the world, here are seven steps to speed you on your way.

title: Muslims vs. Christians on the Sovereignty of God
description: Whereas Allah can act capriciously, the Bible assures believers that God’s sovereignty works in perfect harmony with his justice and love.

title: Lessons from the Middle East
description: Pastor John relays lessons from his trip to the Middle East — The harvest is plentiful, the pastors need teachers, and God has opened the door for the gospel.

title: What Makes Homosexuality Wrong?
description: We know the Bible teaches that homosexual behavior is a sin. Why is that so? Does Scripture give us reasons touching closer to the heart of the issue?

title: Why I Abominate the Prosperity Gospel
description: The “good news” of the prosperity gospel preys upon the poor and leads people into suicidal desires for wealth, all while missing the greater riches of eternal life in Christ.

title: Should Christians Use the Pill?
description: Christians should not use pills that destroy a fertilized egg. But if children are a blessing from the Lord, should contraceptives ever be an option?

title: How Do You Prepare Sermons?
description: Although pastors should find their own rhythms for preparing sermons, the prayer remains the same: “God help me to see and say what’s really in your Word.”

title: How Did You Learn to Preach?
description: Pastor John’s ability to preach rose up out of a heart that was satisfied and thrilled by the Bible.

title: Should Moms Work Outside the Home?
description: Christ’s kingdom advances through the ministry of faithful mothers whose homes are light for their children, and for the world.

title: How Do You Know Christianity Is True?
description: Pastor John walks through three lines of evidence that make a compelling case for the life, death, and resurrection of Jesus Christ.

title: Proud People Don’t Give Thanks
description: Proud hearts don’t know their need for grace, but humble hearts joyfully give thanks to the God who has given them everything, including salvation.

title: Is It Sin to Dislike Divine Election?
description: As believers become more and more like Jesus, they will come to love the things that God loves, in the way that God loves them.

title: Does John 15 Defy Calvinism?
description: In John 15, Jesus cuts off branches that bear no fruit. Does that mean that Christians can lose their salvation?

title: Must a Wife Take Her Husband’s Last Name?
description: Pastor John offers cultural, practical, and biblical support for his encouragement for wives to take their husbands’ last names.

title: Has My Heart Sinned Even If I Stop Words from Exiting My Mouth?
description: Out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks — but what if we stop the speaking? Have we still sinned?

title: Make War Against Pouting
description: All sin makes war on the Christian, so the Christian must make war on all sin — whether sexual immorality or self-pity.

title: Busy Pastors and Biblical Encounters, Part Two
description: How does God provide the food so that his appointed shepherds — time-pressured, busy pastors — can feed their flocks?

title: Busy Pastors and Biblical Encounters, Part One
description: Academia affords more leisurely time to study the Bible, but the pastorate compels shepherds to find daily biblical nourishment daily to feed themselves and their flock.

title: Charismatic Abuses? Discernment and Finances
description: Discernment and financial abuses exist in charismatic and non-charismatic churches alike. Pastor John urges believers to cling to the word of God.

title: Charismatic Abuses? Doctrinal and Emotional
description: Flaws litter charismatic and non-charismatic churches alike. Pastor John has two biblical warnings for those who prize feelings over mature thinking.

title: What Is Prophecy Today?
description: Do new-covenant prophecies carry the same level of authority as Scripture? Pastor John explains three reasons why they don’t.

title: John MacArthur and Strange Fire
description: Paul told the Corinthians to earnestly desire the gift of prophecy. But should Christians today do the same?

title: Travel Updates and Prayer Requests
description: Pastor John talks about his plans to strengthen pastors in the Middle East and asks listeners to pray for strength.

title: Advice for Christian Loners
description: Pastor John encourages Christian loners — even those who have been hurt by the church — to pursue God in Christ-exalting friendships.

title: What Events in this World Echo in Eternity?
description: All of history details the story of God's redemptive grace through Jesus Christ. We will not forget this story in heaven — we will rehearse it forever.

title: Do Christian Hedonists Idolize Joy?
description: Pastor John explains how Christian Hedonism avoids idolizing joy.

title: Dead To the World — What’s That?
description: Jesus surpasses whatever good the world has to offer. So rather than worship those good things, disciples of Jesus receive them as gifts.

title: Finding Joy When Life Hurts Most
description: The doctrine of God’s sovereignty doesn’t only mean that he controls everything, but that he controls everything for the good of his people.

title: God’s Supreme Happiness
description: Pastor John discusses how God's sovereignty relates to joy in God.

title: The Danger of Deserting Community
description: How has God designed our community to help keep us in Christ? Pastor John unpacks God’s prescriptions of prayer and exhortation.

title: God’s Sovereignty over Evil in My Life
description: God does not traffic in futility or vanity. He intends all things, even terrible calamity, for the ultimate good of his people.

title: Does It Make God Evil to Ordain Evil?
description: Pastor John explains God's sovereignty over evil acts without himself being evil.

title: Wisdom in Friendships with Non-Christians
description: How do we reconcile seemingly conflicting commands from Scripture to hang out with the corrupt and to befriend them like Jesus?

title: With So Many Orphans, Why Have Children?
description: Children are a blessing from the God who commands us to be fruitful and multiply. But how does that command fit in a world with orphans who need a home?

title: How Do I Obey and Submit to My Leaders?
description: God calls pastors to lead their churches by serving, not dominating, and he calls congregations to follow with humble teachability.

title: Is Drinking Alcohol a Sin?
description: Alcohol consumption is permissible and can be a blessing, but it is also fraught with dangers.

title: What Pains Here Bring Greater Reward in Heaven?
description: God is working a weight of glory through our hardships, even the ones that seem most trivial.

title: What Does Definite Atonement Offer My Life?
description: For Christians, to embrace the definite atonement is to embrace that Christ set his love on them particularly, specially, and certainly.

title: Why Did God Forbid One Tree in Eden?
description: The forbidden tree was neither an arbitrary test of obedience nor a greedy restriction by a stingy God. It was an insurance policy to secure supreme pleasure.

title: Why Honor C.S. Lewis When He Had So Many Flaws?
description: Although Lewis held several defective doctrines, Pastor John gives six reasons why he remains so helpful to Christians worldwide.

title: How Your Imagination Helps You See
description: A good imagination transforms the normal into the fantastic. A great imagination sees normal things for the wonders they really are.

title: Is God an Egomaniac?
description: God’s pursuit of his own glory is the best possible news for all who seek him because “God is most glorified in us when we are most satisfied in him.”

title: How Do We Walk by the Spirit?
description: Walking by the Spirit can seem vague and hard to live out. Pastor John gives believers practical steps to walk and live by the Spirit.

title: How Did Your Vision for Missions Develop?
description: No other motive provides a better foundation for missions than God’s own zeal to be glorified by blood-bought people from every tribe and tongue.

title: Would You Attend a Gay Wedding?
description: Christians do not celebrate what dishonors Christ. Pastor John gives five reasons why he would not attend a so-called same-sex wedding.

title: Counsel for Busy Moms
description: However mundane dirty diapers and yet another meal may seem, Jesus assures busy moms, “Whoever receives one such child in my name receives me.”

title: Are Christians Called to Obey the Law?
description: Because Christ justifies believers, not their own law-keeping, do Christians still need to keep the commandments?

title: Must Christian Rap Have the Gospel in Every Song?
description: Christ should radiate in and through every rap song, but the gospel need not be explicitly presented every time. Pastor John describes Christ-exalting rap.

title: When Should I Leave My Church?
description: Pastor John describes marks of a healthy church and the combination of factors that may suggest it’s time to leave.

title: Should We Confess Our Sins to a Priest?
description: By his blood, Jesus purchased a unified bride in which the saints lay their souls bare and pray for one another.

title: Botox, Dieting, and Plastic Surgery
description: How should Christians care for their bodies, which the Bible calls temples of God, without idolizing them or investing too much in outer beauty?

title: What’s Your Process for Owning Truth?
description: We can know Scripture, and we can know the Scripture. Take the time to read and analyze, but leave plenty of time to experience it as well.

title: How Do I Own Biblical Truths for Myself?
description: How should believers pursue affections for Jesus in a broken world where those affections seem to rise and fall constantly?

title: Is Tithing Commanded for Christians?
description: Christ has fulfilled the Old Testament law for his people. But does that mean God no longer expects us to tithe?

title: How Do We Know God’s Will?
description: Ninety percent of our daily decisions have no guiding list. But a mind renewed by God through his word and Spirit can know the delightful taste of God’s will.

title: Jesus’s Sheep Hear His Voice — What’s That Mean?
description: The mark of Jesus's sheep is that they hear and believe the saving word of the gospel preached to them.

title: Can a Sinner Be Saved After Death?
description: Pastor John unpacks the story of the rich man and Lazarus to show the great chasm fixed between believers and unbelievers after death.

title: Can a Sinner Be Saved at Death?
description: The Lord can and will show mercy to sinners who repent in the eleventh hour. Yet, spiritual corpses who love their sin cannot raise themselves from the dead.

title: Should We Brag About Our Favorite Teachers?
description: Believers walk day by day as servants of others because their Savior is alive, their Father is King, the Spirit is present, and their reward is coming.

title: Do We Need Christian Role Models?
description: There are rich biblical grounds for saying, "Yes, believers do need role models in Christ." God has given us one another to imitate.

title: Is It Sinful to Date a Non-Christian?
description: Marriage — and dating on that trajectory — cannot be the beautiful union God designed it to be if he himself is not in the picture.

title: This Week’s Conference on C.S. Lewis
description: Pastor John gives a taste of the upcoming Desiring God National Conference, centered around C.S. Lewis.

title: Does James Say Not to Pursue Joy?
description: There is a time for everything. When confronted by our sin, sorrow is the appropriate reaction — the one that can lead to true repentance.

title: How Do I Motivate My Church for Ministry?
description: If you want to motivate your church, don’t start with programs and activities. Start with a vision of God’s glory.

title: Fighting Bitterness
description: Bitterness flows from a heart that feels the pain of injustice. Forgiveness flows from a heart overcome by trust in God’s justice.

title: How Singleness Is Good
description: Marriage only lasts a lifetime. The relationships Christians build with one another last for eternity.

title: Why Adam’s Singleness Was Not Good
description: Psalm 73 declares that God’s people desire nothing on earth besides God. Why then was it “not good” that Adam was alone with God?

title: Have I Exhausted God’s Patience with My Sin?
description: If you feel any measure of fear of judgment, or horror for your sin, turn to Jesus and repent — it’s not too late.

title: Should We Listen for the Audible Voice of God?
description: God still speaks today through his living, active word. All other revelation must be tested against Scripture (and hopefully alongside wise believers).

title: When I’m Bored of the Bible — What Can I Do?
description: Christians are like farmers who, in reading God’s word, tend their gardens day by day, even when the fruit is not yet visible.

title: Is My Husband’s Porn a Marriage Deal-Breaker?
description: Marriage is a lifelong, God-wrought covenant. God did not create it to break — even when one partner goes back on their vows by viewing pornography.

title: Salt, Light, and Complaining
description: Pastor John explains how complaining not only diminishes the light of God’s power and goodness, but also the light of his reward for his children.

title: What My Complaining Says About God
description: Complaining snuffs out the light that believers hold — the light of God’s goodness, his power, and his wisdom in the midst of a dark world.

title: Do Promises in the Psalms Apply to Me?
description: Some psalms relate to specific events in the life of David or Israel, so how should Christians take the promises in those psalms?

title: Why Evangelicals Go Catholic
description: Pastor John identifies some of the reasons why evangelicals go to the Catholic Church, along with some of the issues with Catholic teaching.

title: Is Abortion Like the Holocaust?
description: Pastor John discusses the similarities and differences between the Holocaust and abortion, ending with this certainty: God will settle every account.

title: What Is Gossip?
description: Gossip springs up from a proud and negative heart that hides beneath a veneer of concern and love.

title: John Piper’s Testimony
description: Pastor John shares the story of his testimony. He can’t remember it, yet it is still amazing.

title: What Is Legalism?
description: The word “legalism” is not found in the Bible. So what do people mean when they contrast legalism with the gospel?

title: Women As Ministers?
description: God equips women to minister mightily in this world. Pastor John clarifies 1 Timothy 2 and calls women to endless possibilities.

title: Does God Remember Our Sins or Forget Them?
description: Pastor John examines how God can both remember and forget sins according to what will work the most for our good.

title: Why Is My Evangelism at Work So Lame?
description: It is difficult, even strange, to turn workplace conversations from football and fashion to the gospel. How then should believers approach evangelism at work?

title: What Does It Mean to Be Made in God’s Image?
description: Sin defaces the image of God, but it doesn’t destroy it. Pastor John explains what it means to be made in the image of God in this age of redemption.

title: Battling Jealousy
description: The jealousy of God is both righteous and loving; often, our jealousy is sinful and selfish. How can Christians distinguish these jealousies?

title: Battling Envy
description: Envy rises up out of a resentful, discontent hearts. Therefore, trust in God’s goodness is the believer’s secret weapon in the battle against envy.

title: How Does the Spirit Testify I’m Saved?
description: The Holy Spirit testifies that believers are God’s children by working good fruit in their lives and a cry in their hearts: “Father! Lord!”

title: My Husband Is Okay with Racy Scenes — I Hate It
description: Behind sexual scenes in entertainment swirls a sea of lust, adultery, and hate — sexual sin that killed Jesus, and that Jesus died to kill.

title: When a Christian Won’t Repent from Sexual Sin
description: The four steps of biblical discipline are designed to keep the church holy and pure while it loves the unrepentant back to Jesus.

title: Is It Selfish to Pray for Joy?
description: Pastor John defines selfishness and discusses the holy pursuit for joy in prayers.

title: God’s Fame and Global Missions
description: Pastor John talks about God’s plan to take his glory to the nations, the spreading of his name.

title: Am I Lukewarm?
description: Self-satisfied hearts that don’t see their desperate need for the all-satisfying Christ are the seedbed for lukewarm Christianity.

title: What Advice Would You Give Newly Married John Piper?
description: Many of us marry with little idea of the gifts and hardships ahead. So what would Pastor John tell his newly married self?

title: Work Like an Arminian, Sleep Like a Calvinist?
description: Work, play, and sleep like a Calvinist — outproduce, outplay, and outdream everyone by trusting in your sovereign God.

title: Avoiding Ministry Burnout
description: Pastor John shares eight practical counsels to avoid ministry burnout, starting with, “Love what you do.”

title: Help! I’m Addicted to Lying
description: When a lie would win approval and favor from others, a Christian’s truth-telling hinges on contentment in the approval and favor of God.

title: God Loves the Sinner, But Hates the Sin?
description: If we don’t understand that God finds us hateful and loathsome in our sin, we won’t be as stunned by the depth of his love for us.

title: How Do I Know I’m Saved?
description: Believers know their own sin all too well. How can they know they are saved? Pastor John offers encouragement for those struggling with assurance.

title: Slavery and Jonathan Edwards
description: Though a great thinker, Jonathan Edwards was blind on the issue of slavery. Pastor John offers five sobering responses to those who read him.

title: Is Discouragement a Sin?
description: The Bible accommodates strong, godly emotions, but how do we know when godly anger or discouragement has become sinful?

title: God Does Make Much of Us
description: Pastor John explains how God actually does make much of us, so that we might make much of him.

title: Childlike, Not Childish
description: How can Christians pursue a childlike faith while growing mature in their thinking like the Bible commands?

title: Can I Say ‘God Loves You’ to Unbelievers?
description: Although God loves his people with a special, electing love, he loves all people by freely offering his Son for them to receive.

title: If God Is Happy, Why Does He Seem Angry?
description: God delights in all of his works in the grand scope of God’s redemptive plan. But in the day-to-day sins and struggles of his image-bearers, God grieves.

title: What Is Evil?
description: The heart of evil lies in its desire for other things above God. When evil looks out at all that is, it chooses creation over Creator.

title: Bible Memory as Ministry to Others
description: By memorizing and reciting Scripture before others, believers become emissaries of grace who make mundane moments explode with significance.

title: I’ve Sinned Horribly, Is There Any Hope?
description: Pastor John walks through Psalm 107 to call Christians who have sinned grievously and foolishly to cry out to the God of steadfast, enduring love.

title: On Ghostwriters
description: Properly attributing people's work is a matter of honesty. God wants us to give credit where it's due.

title: How Do I Delight Myself in the Lord?
description: Delight in God as most admirable. Delight in God as Savior and friend. Delight in God through his gifts. And you will delight yourself in the Lord.

title: Advice for Better Bible Reading
description: If you struggle in your Bible reading, Pastor John commends copying down the Scriptures each day and gives four reasons why.

title: Mealtime Prayers: Impromptu or Memorized?
description: Spontaneous and memorized prayers teach families important aspects of a real, dynamic relationship with God.

title: Patriotism and the Christian
description: God’s people are Christians before they are patriots, but they still work for the good of their homelands.

title: Mealtime Prayers: Necessary or Optional?
description: Prayers at meals, even when we don't feel like making them, form soul-nourishing habits of joy that can pass from generation to generation.

title: How Food and Sex Are Made Holy
description: Food and sex easily turn from gifts into gods. Pastor John encourages believers to dethrone false gods by thanking the true God for his gifts.

title: Is My Boyfriend’s Porn a Marriage Deal-Breaker?
description: Porn ravages souls. Porn demeans women. Porn destroys love. So should porn use be a marriage deal-breaker?

title: Suffering, Sacrifice, and Christian Hedonism
description: Christian hedonism does not ignore pain for the sake of joy. Rather, it exclaims that God is satisfying enough to give you joy in the midst of pain.

title: Does Christian Hedonism Make Joy an Idol?
description: Don’t delight in delight, glorify God by rejoicing in him, and three more safeguards against idolizing joy for Christian Hedonists.

title: What Does It Mean to Be Dead to the World?
description: Jesus surpasses whatever good the world has to offer. So rather than worship those good things, disciples of Jesus receive them as gifts.

title: Is the 40-Minute Sermon Passé?
description: Some tire of listening to sermons, as though they were lectures. But a preacher is not a professor, but a herald of God, proclaiming the good news to the church.

title: The Joy of Calvinism and the Fight for Joy
description: God’s sovereign working in the gospel assures his people that no hardship is wasted and no wrongdoing will slip by unnoticed. He will settle every account.

title: God’s Joy and the Joy of the Calvinist
description: God’s joy in himself bears up his self-sufficient, sovereign work in the world. Pastor John unpacks God’s infinite, trinitarian joy.

title: Why Is Interracial Marriage Such a Hot Topic?
description: Christians celebrate interracial marriage, but black-white marriage especially touches sensitive cultural nerves. Pastor John identifies five of them.

title: Tornados and Twitter Timing
description: In light of two regrettable tweets, Pastor John shares the lessons he learned about how, when, and where to speak online.

title: Natural Disasters and Pastoral Ministry
description: When catastrophes hit, pastors should lead their churches toward a healthy response — filled with mourning and worship.

title: Adjusting to Life in the Country
description: While God calls us to spend most of our time in the thick of regular life and ministry, occasional retreats are good for refreshing the soul.

title: Our Move to Tennessee and New Projects
description: Pastor John reflects on his move to Tennessee — both his motives for moving and the projects he hopes to accomplish while living there.

title: Why Eternal Security Needs Community
description: Eternal life is sure for the bride of Christ. But prayers and exhortations of Christian community may be the very means God uses to preserve his people.

title: For Christian Loners
description: Pastor John encourages Christian loners — even those who have been hurt by the church — to pursue God in Christ-exalting friendships.

title: Affections and Emotions
description: Our affections move us to not only eat, but savor; not only avoid what is evil, but despise it; not only sing by rote, but worship God with delight.

title: Who Has Been Most Influential in Your Life?
description: Pastor John shares his personal list of influencers — people who contributed significantly to shaping his mind.

title: How Evangelistic Should Sundays Be?
description: The one gospel does two things: It feeds the saints week by week and it calls unbelievers to repent and believe in Jesus for salvation.

title: Personal Comfort in God’s Sovereignty Over Evil
description: If God is absent, life is meaningless; if he is helpless, we have no hope. But if he is sovereign, he works even evil for the good of his children.

title: Can God Ordain Evil Without Being Evil?
description: If no single evil act falls outside of God’s control, how can God be completely good?

title: On Pastors Who Use Churches as Studios
description: God may choose to extend the influence of a pastor beyond the church doors, but his call remains the same: Faithfully feed your flock.

title: Can a Born-Again Christian Lose Salvation?
description: A born-again person cannot be unborn again. If God has called you by name, he is faithful to keep you until the end.

title: Is Jeremiah 29:11 a Promise to Christians?
description: If the promise in Jeremiah 29:11 was made to exiles in Babylon, what business do Christians have claiming it for themselves?

title: Boundaries for Non-Christian Friendships
description: In their friendships with non-Christians, are believers loving and transforming, or conforming and being transformed?

title: Stranded on a Desert Island, What Books Do You Bring?
description: What three books would you want with you if you were stranded on a desert island? Pastor John shares his three picks.

title: Can a White Woman Marry a Black Man?
description: God does not restrict believers from marrying someone with a different skin color. He only requires that they be a Christ-follower.

title: On Cussing
description: If you feel tempted to cuss, ask, “Is it going to build this person up? Will it make them stronger? Will it make Christ more beautiful in their eyes?”

title: Will World History Become the Ballad of Eternity?
description: God does not intend for us to forget about our earthly lives when we enter heaven. We will be singing about the trophies of his grace for all eternity.

title: Encouragement for Ordinary Pastors
description: A local pastor does not need to compete with Tim Keller, John Piper, and Matt Chandler. He simply needs to faithfully expound the Bible to his people.

title: Do Online Sermons Undermine Local Churches?
description: The internet has flooded believers with solid biblical content. But it can never replace a pastor whom God has called to shepherd a local church.

title: What Does Opposition to Chris Broussard Tell Us?
description: Although more people will abandon and defile the truth as the end approaches, God may still bring a mighty outpouring of his grace before Christ returns.

title: Was Chris Broussard Right?
description: God will condemn homosexual practice just as he does thievery and greed. All our broken desires deserve God’s wrath as their punishment.

title: Facing Death Faithfully
description: When death draws near, God’s word assures believers that God will not withhold any good from them, even when it feels they are losing so much.

title: A Mother’s Role in Raising Boys
description: Moms, don’t assume that only dad can show their son what it means to be a man. Moms have a unique role in helping sons grasp manhood.

title: Choosing a Seminary
description: Faculty matters more than buildings when you are deciding what seminary to attend. You need to find a place where everyone cherishes the Bible.

title: Was C.S. Lewis a Christian Hedonist?
description: Lewis has helped Pastor John shape what he calls Christian Hedonism, but does he believe that C.S. Lewis was himself a Christian Hedonist?

title: Appreciating Creation While Anticipating New Creation
description: C.S. Lewis can help us see the beauty of the creation around us because he knew that this beauty points us to the more satisfying Creator.

title: How Did Lewis Prepare You for Edwards?
description: C.S. Lewis build conceptual categories for John Piper. Jonathan Edwards set the content on fire with Bible.

title: How Do You Process Public Tragedy?
description: God’s sovereign ability to stop tragedies never undoes our calling to weep with those who weep, to help however we can, and to lament the evil in it all.

title: How Far Is Too Far Before Marriage, Spiritually and Emotionally?
description: Couples often set physical boundaries, but overlook the spiritual and emotional lines we cross in relationships. How, then, can we guard ourselves from going too far before marriage?

title: How Has C. S. Lewis Influenced You?
description: Lewis awakened a teenage pastor John to the wonder of the world. He taught him that rigorous logic and romantic language can go together.

title: When Did You First Meet C.S. Lewis?
description: C.S. Lewis has made a lasting impact on pastor John because of his ability to be lucid, logical, illuminating, large-hearted, and joyfully longing.

title: Why Host a Conference on C. S. Lewis?
description: C.S. Lewis’s writing has continued to affect millions today, but should we ever host an entire Christian conference focused on a person other than Christ?

title: How to Handle Panhandlers
description: The Bible calls believers to give to the one who begs, but how can we obey this commandment without being ripped off or feeding someone’s bad habits?

title: How to Fight Laziness
description: Hard work is not a consequence of the fall, but a gift. If we are going to fight laziness, we need to develop a good theology of work.

title: When Jehovah’s Witnesses Knock at Your Door
description: Christians and Jehovah’s Witnesses have major differences that we can’t ignore when they visit. But how can you love them well if you don’t have time to debate?

title: Christians and Marijuana
description: Marijuana continues to become legal in more and more states. As the drug becomes more common, how should we think about it from a biblical worldview?

title: The Power to Conquer Selfishness
description: Anyone can use their power to command others, but there is a unique greatness and power found in those who chose to serve through Christ.

title: Reflections on His Last Sermon As Pastor
description: As Pastor John preached his farewell sermon, he wanted to point Bethlehem to the great shepherd who would be with them long after he was gone.

title: How Are Teachers Judged More Strictly?
description: Because teachers have been given more, God will hold them more accountable. He will judge them on how they used the opportunity they were given.

title: How Far Is Too Far Before Marriage?
description: God designed sex to bring joy, and he reserved this gift for marriage. How can we guard ourselves to avoid awakening sexual feelings outside marriage?

title: What Is the Purpose of Fasting?
description: Fasting only adds to our hunger for God. Through fasting, we put our stomach where our hearts are to give added intensity to our ache for Jesus.

title: Do Christians and Muslims Worship the Same Deity?
description: Pastor John explains why Muslims do not worship the God of the Bible.

title: Was Jesus for Real?
description: How can we be sure that Jesus is who he said he is? Can we have any assurance the Jesus we read about in the Bible is real?

title: Is Jesus the Only Way to Be Saved?
description: It might feel unloving to say that Jesus is the only way, but it would be even more unloving not to.

title: What Do You Think of Your Influence on Christian Hip Hop?
description: At least twelve rap songs have been directly influenced by Pastor John, how does he feel about this legacy?

title: The Parent’s Role in a Child’s Gender Development
description: God calls parents to love their children enough to shape them into future men and women. But how much influence should a parent have?

title: Wimpy Theology Makes Wimpy Women
description: Pastors and husbands reject complementarity when they cripple women by not encouraging them to study, mediate, and ponder deeply.

title: What Is “Strong Feminine Womanhood?”
description: A hope-filled woman finds her strength in the God who comforts her as she finds shelter in him.

title: Advice for Discouraged, Unemployed College Grads
description: Worried about where you will work? God’s mercy finds us even when the job search leaves us defeated.

title: How Do Believers Exceed the Works of Jesus?
description: Jesus promised that we would do greater works than he did. What does that mean, and have you done any?

title: Fasting from Twitter and Facebook
description: Social media can reveal how much we love to be known and liked. It’s one mirror revealing our fear of man.

title: Twitter Goals and “Humble Brags”
description: How should believers use social media? In a world that loves broadcasting selfies and counting retweets, we must find better ways to tweet.

title: How Can We Serve One Another in Battling Lust?
description: Lust is serious enough to take extreme measures to put to death. This applies not only to our own efforts but also to the efforts of accountability partners.

title: Living Easter Sunday’s Victory on Monday Morning
description: If the realities of Monday morning threaten the joys we found on Easter Sunday, we haven’t realized promises given to us at the cross.

title: What Makes Easter So Special?
description: What we celebrate on Easter is the foundational hinge of Christianity.

title: Do You Use Bible Commentaries Written by Women?
description: Does a pastor’s use of a female-authored commentary put him in opposition to Paul’s instruction that women should not teach or have authority over men in the church?

title: How Do I Know If I Love the Gifts More Than the Giver?
description: The possibility of turning God’s gifts into idols is a result of sin. But this doesn’t mean we should reject the gifts.

title: How Jesus’s Glory Drives Creative Communication
description: It is foolish and prideful to believe we can save anyone with the words we choose. But God chooses to save through “the word of Christ,” so how should we think about the language we use?

title: Can We Reconcile Creation and Evolution?
description: Is it possible to combine evolution with Christianity? Should we even try?

title: How Does It Glorify God to Predestine People to Hell?
description: In the final judgment, God’s justice will be fully vindicated, his grace and mercy will be underlined, and our worship will be intensified.

title: My Faith Is Driving My Family Away — What Do I Do?
description: The tension arising from believing the gospel in an unbelieving family can be severe. Pastor John has this to say to Christians feeling the pain of family division because of their faith.

title: Does It Bother You People Are Entertained by Your Gestures?
description: What is Pastor John's response to people who are amused by his movement and gestures behind the pulpit?

title: What’s with All the Preaching Gestures?
description: Pastor John is well-known for his movements behind the pulpit. What role do those gestures play in preaching, and how much thought goes into them?

title: Do You Ever Doubt God’s Existence?
description: The more we consider the world around us and the Jesus of our Bibles, the more we can see that God is real.

title: Why No Pastor Lives Up to What He Preaches
description: If a pastor is preaching properly, he will regularly fall short of his own preaching. How can pastors avoid becoming overwhelmed by this reality?

title: Care for Couples Struggling with Infertility
description: What might be said to couples dealing with the deep pain of childlessness? Pastor John identifies some pillars of hope for those grieving over infertility.

title: How Do I Know If I’m Being Disciplined by God?
description: God’s discipline could come through suffering or a cool breeze on a sunny day. If God’s discipline comes in various forms, how can we know if we’re being disciplined?

title: What Oppressive Governments Cannot Do
description: Paul wrote that “rulers are not a terror to good conduct, but to bad.” But rulers sentenced Jesus to death, so how should we understand Paul’s words?

title: Does Romans 13 Prohibit All Civil Disobedience?
description: Paul says to submit to the government God has established. Does this include evil and unjust governments?

title: Biblical Womanhood in Five Minutes
description: What does it mean to be a woman? Here are four ways the Bible defines womanhood.

title: What’s the Connection Between IQ and Holiness?
description: The Bible requires us to use our minds to grow in holiness. Does this mean that smarter people have a leg up on holiness?

title: Do You Conduct Funerals for Non-Christians?
description: Christian pastors should never conduct a generic funeral for unbelievers. There is always something hopeful for us to say at funerals.

title: How Can I Help My Friends Stay Satisfied in God?
description: Christians help their friends be satisfied in Christ by speaking God's promises to each other, and by filling our own wells of joy in God.

title: God Hears My Prayers, So Why Should I Pray for Things Twice?
description: Jesus tells us to repeat our prayers with persistence, but he also says that God disregards vain repetition. So how do we know when to repeat ourselves?

title: A Theology of Prayer in Three Minutes
description: Regardless of how God answers our individual prayers, he loves to hear them, and he will use them to establish his kingdom once and for all.

title: How Can I Live More Like an Evangelist?
description: If we want to become more evangelistically-minded, we should constantly ask, “What is God doing here?”

title: Why Pastoral Professionalism Isn’t Enough
description: Pastor John gives his thoughts on the 2013 Conference for Pastors, “Brothers, We Are Still Not Professionals.”

title: Why Your Pastor Needs Your Prayers
description: One of your pastor's greatest needs is for you to pray for him.

title: The Spirit Lives in Me, So Why Do My Affections Waver?
description: If God is the source of the Christian’s joy, and God lives in us, why are there times when we don’t feel joy?

title: Should Missionaries Intentionally Lie?
description: Is it okay for missionaries to lie in order to do ministry in closed countries?

title: How Do Rape, Incest, and Threat to the Mother’s Life Affect Your Pro-Life Stance?
description: Should the difficult circumstances of some pregnancies affect our pro-life position?

title: Three Levels of God-Glorifying Emotion
description: Is God glorified in our desire to enjoy him? Or can we only glorify God when we're actually delighting in him?

title: A Theology of Art in Five Minutes
description: What role should art play in the church and the Christian life? A Christian theology of art considers God as an artist who commands creativity from his creation.

title: Should a Joyless Pastor Preach Joy in God?
description: How do you preach joy in God when you have almost no feeling of it? Pastor John gives some helpful counsel for pastors struggling to experience joy in the Lord.

title: Fighting for Joy in Pastoral Ministry
description: Pastor John offers counsel for pastors and others challenged by spiritual dryness and burnout.

title: Must Bible Reading Always End with Application?
description: What are you looking for in your Bible reading? Do you hope mainly to glean life principles or to be shaped by what you see of God's glory?

title: What Is Leadership?
description: What does godly leadership look like? Christian Leadership is acting and speaking to create a following toward a goal, all defined by the Bible.

title: Writing Poetry: Where Do I Start?
description: Pastor John offers practical help for Christians who want to write poetry but don’t know how to start.

title: What Is Definite Atonement, and Why Does It Matter?
description: Pastor John introduces definite atonement, the doctrine that Christ’s death accomplished a real salvation for a definite group of men and women.

title: Priorities for Youth Pastors
description: What are the fundamental truths that youth leaders and pastors should drill into the hearts of young people today?

title: What Does Christian Hedonism Offer the Depressed?
description: Our joy does not only glorify God when we feel happy and carefree. God is also glorified when we cling to his supreme worth in the midst of pain.

title: How Active Should We Be in the Pursuit of Joy?
description: Should Christians pursue joy in God, or should they wait for God to simply give it to them? Pastor John clarifies our call to rejoice in the Lord.

title: Does God Ever Withdraw His Presence from His Children?
description: Christian Hedonists affirm that we ought to be happy in God. Often, we are not. What should our response be to seasons of spiritual darkness?

title: Fighting Porn Addiction with Grudem’s Systematic Theology
description: Heaven and hell are at stake in the fight against pornography. When we recognize that, using every weapon at our disposal won’t feel extreme.

title: We Are Makers — Lessons on Vocation from Dorothy Sayers
description: Christians should think of themselves as being made new in Christ to be makers with God.

title: Interpreting the Miracles of Jesus
description: To understand the significance of Jesus’s miracles, we should begin by simply slowing down and asking, “What does this say about Jesus?”

title: Why False Doctrine Can Make You Happy
description: Does doctrine matter so long as we feel happy in God? Pastor John explains why only a true view of God can glorify him and satisfy us.

title: Why John Piper Recycles
description: Why should Christians care about this earth if we are waiting for a new one? Ultimately, it is because we love our neighbors.

title: The Essential Warfare for Holiness
description: We don’t add happiness to holiness in the Christian life. Our happiness in God is an essential piece of what it means to be holy.

title: Exercising the Body (For the Sake of the Soul)
description: God cares about what we do with the bodies he’s given to us. We should govern our eating, sleeping, and exercise to maximize our life and soul for the kingdom.

title: What Is the Difference Between Right Risk and Wrong Risk?
description: All Christians are called to risk. But how do we know when the risk is worth it and which risks we should take personally?

title: Safety Is a Myth
description: Risk is unavoidable in life. It is better to risk rightly, for the sake of Christ’s glory, than to try avoid all danger.

title: Arrests and Imprisonments in Opposing Abortion
description: Pastor John shares his experiences of being arrested for anti-abortion demonstrations and offers some principles for civil disobedience in opposing abortions.

title: Leadership Lessons from Martin Luther King
description: Despite his flaws, Martin Luther King, Jr. was an effective leader because he was courageous, brilliant, and a visionary.

title: What Are Your Takeaways from Passion 2013?
description: After preaching to 60,000 students at the Passion conference, Pastor John discusses the movement and its core desire for God’s name and renown.

title: What Is It Like Preaching to 60,000 People?
description: Pastor John recently preached to 60,000 at Passion. He talks about the unique temptations and mercies of speaking on such a large platform.

title: Why Adam Matters for Global Missions
description: Whether we believe in a historical Adam or not will affect more than our theology. For instance, his existence is one powerful tool in world missions.

title: Was Adam for Real, and Does It Matter?
description: Does it matter whether we think Adam really existed or not? Pastor John talks about what is at stake in a major debate over Genesis.

title: How Important Is a Christian Writer’s Influence?
description: Writers should utilize their influence carefully, while allowing the process of writing to open their own eyes and shape their own souls.

title: Who Was George Herbert?
description: In his life, ministry, and poetry, George Herbert wrestled with the tension between worldly ambition and godly ambition. What can we learn from him?

title: Reflections from John Piper on His Birthday
description: On his 67th birthday, Pastor John reflects on God's grace to him as a husband, father, and pastor, and asks for prayer over his final era of life and ministry.

title: Your Bible-Reading Feedback, and How to Help Us in 2025
description: Hear John Piper’s invitation to partner with us. A $10 monthly gift enables us to reach 70 more people with God-centered resources. https://dsr.gd/3AYGuj2
